Title: AI Applied Engineer
Description:
About Lovable...




We’re Lovable: a small, ambitious crew of serial founders, physicists, competitive programmers, and product engineers.

Our goal? Be the first to make autonomous code generation work.

We’re pioneering a new way for anyone to create and maintain web apps using plain English. Combining LLMs + novel UX + clever algorithms, we’re building a bridge between coders and non-coders.




The role: AI Applied Engineer




You’ll be at the cutting edge of autonomous coding, ensuring that our product is robust, reliable, and continually pushing the frontier of what’s possible.

Your mission is to identify the biggest challenges impacting reliability—and come up with inventive, creative solutions. This isn’t just about making things work; it’s about making them unfailingly excellent and scalable.




What you’ll do:




Push the Limits: Identify bottlenecks and failure points in our code generation pipeline and devise ingenious ways to overcome them.
Innovate & Iterate: Experiment with state-of-the-art reliability techniques for LLMs and autonomous agents.
Rapid Debugging: Pinpoint and resolve complex reliability issues with speed and precision.
Data-Driven Improvements: Analyze reliability patterns, run failure analyses, and implement strategies to boost accuracy and performance.
Dogfood to the Max: Rigorously use our own product for internal development, pushing it to the limit in real-world scenarios, surface edge cases, break things (on purpose), and refine the product from the inside out.




What we’re looking for:




Full-Stack Proficiency: Experience working with full-stack applications, preferably using React on the frontend.
Experience with LLMs: Practical experience working with LLMs and their quirks.
Inventive Problem-Solving: You see challenges as puzzles waiting to be cracked, and you bring unconventional ideas to the table.
Fast Debugger: You can quickly identify, analyze, and fix complex AI Applied issues.
Bias for Action: You move fast, experiment, and iterate; shipping solutions is in your DNA.
Curiosity for the Cutting Edge: You stay up-to-date with the latest research and apply it pragmatically.
Strong Communication: Ability to clearly explain reliability challenges, solutions, and trade-offs to both technical and non-technical teammates.




Why Lovable?




Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis




If you’re ready to help build the last piece of software—we want to hear from you. Let’s make something Lovable.




About your application:




Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system.
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you. Hit apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.
Show more

Why Lovable?

If you’re ready to help build the last piece of software—we want to hear from you. Let’s make something Lovable.

  • Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
  • We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system.
  • We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you. Hit apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.

Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.

You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.

Who You Are

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.

You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Proficiency in Swedish


What We Offer


Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo

🔍 About Odevo

🌐 Our Software
Show more

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
  • Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
  • Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
  • Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  • Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
  • Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
  • You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
  • Proficiency in Swedish

What We Offer

  • Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
  • Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
  • Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
  • Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.

Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo

🔍 About Odevo

🌐 Our Software

Title: Applied Ai Engineer
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Applied AI Engineer, you will play an important role in unlocking the potential of Gen AI throughout our organisation. Your hands-on approach and focus on applying Gen AI to address real-world challenges will be key in driving innovation and efficiency. This role offers a platform for you to make a significant impact, with the freedom to execute on our Gen AI strategy, discover high-value applications, and take lead on technical implementation.

Role

Imagine building transformative solutions like implementing real-time actions based on rider feedback from the app or creating a diagnosis and repairs co-pilot for mechanics and in-field workers. These are just a glimpse of the exciting and impactful projects you will spearhead in this role, shaping the way we leverage AI technology. This will include:


Developing frameworks and tooling that make it easier for R&D teams to integrate Gen AI into products.
Designing and building pragmatic, production-ready Gen AI solutions for various business use cases.
Working with teams across the company to understand their challenges and apply AI where it creates real value.
Balancing innovation with practicality, ensuring we use the right AI tools for the job rather than chasing the latest trends.
Ensuring solutions are scalable, cost-efficient, and secure, following best practices for deploying AI in production.
Staying up to date with the rapidly evolving AI landscape and helping define our AI adoption strategy.


What You Need To Embark

To have the best possible start with us, we believe you have:


Software engineering background, ideally in backend or ML development and system integration.
Experience using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, vector databases, RAG, AI agents).
Curiosity and pragmatism – you focus on delivering value, not just exploring technology.
Experience building AI-powered applications that integrate with real-world systems.
Ability to work autonomously, define your own roadmap, and drive projects forward.
Strong collaboration skills – comfortable working with technical and non-technical teams alike.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing “safe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone”
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Lead Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm and take ownership of a critical project for one of our major clients. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of deep technical expertise and strategic consulting. You will be responsible for leading the development of machine learning solutions from conception to final production deployment, ensuring high-quality results while effectively engaging with stakeholders.




Responsibilities




Lead end-to-end development of machine learning models, from data exploration to production deployment.
Work closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver impactful AI-driven insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Manage your own work, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality results while collaborating with team members.
Apply MLOps best practices to streamline deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Ensure that solutions adhere to robust software engineering principles, enabling scalability and maintainability.
Mentor junior data scientists and provide thought leadership within the organization.




Requirements




5+ years of experience in data science and machine learning, with a proven track record of delivering production-grade solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to design and optimize machine learning models for real-world use cases.
Strong expertise in Python and the standard data science tech stack (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, etc.).
Excellent communication and consulting skills - able to engage with stakeholders, present findings, and drive discussions.
Understanding of MLOps principles and tools for model deployment, monitoring, and automation.
Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
Background in logistics is beneficial but not required.
Excellent English skills.




About Us




CoCreate AI is a recently founded AI consulting company, with big ambitions to grow. We offer a dynamic and innovative work environment where you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of AI solutions. As a remote-first company, we collaborate with businesses across Europe, solving real-world challenges with cutting-edge machine learning and AI technologies. If you're looking to grow with a young, fast-moving company and make a real impact, this is the place for you.




Why Join CoCreate AI?




Competitive Compensation: Competitive salary and pension for long-term stability.
Remote-First & Flexible Work: Work where and how you want with our flexible work culture.
Continuous Learning & Growth: Access a learning and conference budget, plus mentorship from senior experts.
Cutting-Edge Innovation: Work on AI solutions that make a real impact across industries.
Workations & Team Travel: Join team trips to inspiring locations for collaboration and growth.
Top-Tier Equipment: Work with a brand new MacBook Pro and iPhone (private use included).




If you're ready to take on an exciting challenge and drive AI innovation in the logistics sector, we'd love to hear from you!




Apply now and be part of CoCreate AI's journey to transform businesses with AI.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
Description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.

Din kompetens & profil

Machine Learning Engineer

Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter



Data Engineer

Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.



Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.

Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.

Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.

Frågor och kontakt

Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Turn complex data into smart, scalable solutions that fuel growth, optimize customer journeys, and deliver real impact for top-tier brands.




What we are looking for:

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to join our team and drive real impact for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels, such as online, email, and commerce, to analyze and model information that optimizes customer journeys and boosts digital performance. You’re someone who loves working with complex data, productionalizing systems, and econometric modeling to help brands grow and improve efficiency.




Your background in data science and statistics enables you to spot trends, devise strategies, and directly influence client success. In this role, you’ll design predictive models, develop algorithms, and deliver end-to-end solutions. You stay on top of evolving technologies like AI, always exploring new ways to push your work forward.




You’ll be joining a supportive environment where collaboration is key. While you bring solid experience, we’re committed to your ongoing professional growth in the ever-changing worlds of data science and digital marketing.




What you'll be doing:




Take e-commerce problems into solutions using statistical and ML models
Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions
Present findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Remain current with the latest data science and digital marketing trends




Qualifications:




Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Familiarity with commerce data
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining containerized production-grade ML workloads in production
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden




What sets you apart:




Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
Experience with predictive models in commerce.







This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

  • Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
  • Experience with predictive models in commerce.



This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Avalanche Studios Group is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data team and drive the Data & Analytics strategy for Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open-world game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios!

This role will be responsible for owning and developing analytics strategies and collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams. It requires experience from live product environments, strong leadership skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with our publishing partner, Microsoft. This is a key role that combines technical expertise, strategic thinking, and leadership to ensure that Contraband delivers exceptional player experiences and meets its business goals.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement robust analytics strategies tailored to a live premium AAA game.
Collaborate with Data, Product, Creative, and Tech teams to align analytics efforts with broader project goals.
Design and implement advanced data models, pipelines, A/B tests and dashboards to monitor game performance and player behavior.
Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable insights that guide game and business decisions.
Ensure seamless communication and collaboration with Microsoft’s Business, Product, Data, and Tech teams to drive analytics success.
Promote a culture of data excellence by sharing best practices, mentoring the team, and providing training across the organization.
Design efficient and scalable analytics processes, conducting regular code and methodology reviews.


Who You Are


Proven experience (5+ years) as a Data Scientist or a similar role, preferably in gaming or digital entertainment.
Proven experience leading analytics strategies for live games or similar live product environments, ideally in the premium AA or AAA gaming space.
Expertise in visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R.
Advanced SQL Skills: Writing complex, optimized SQL queries and understanding query performance tuning.
Experience collaborating across disciplines (Product, Creative, Tech) and with publishers.
Strong communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to diverse audiences along with the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A passion for gaming!


Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.

The Stockholm location

Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.

Our values

At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.

How To Apply

To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.

At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Consumer, Payments)
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

About Consumer Analytics At Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

About The Payments Domain

Payment Group at Wolt is building a world-class payment infrastructure for the best customer experience. You’ll be part of the team working on a smooth, scalable, and secure checkout experience adapting to the many use cases of consumers.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Payments, we're looking for someone like you!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience with the Payments domain - we’ll pay lots of attention to this experience.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Description:
IPercept Technology AB

Job Title:  Junior Analytics Engineer

Job Type: Starting with an internship, with the potential to turn into full-time employment

Location: Stockholm, Sweden 

Job Summary

We are looking for a motivated Junior Analytics Engineer to join our team, starting as an intern with the opportunity to transition into a full-time role in the summer. This is a great opportunity for a recent graduate or final-year student with a strong technical background and a passion for analytics in mechanical and production systems.

We are looking for someone with a keen interest and knowledge in the following areas: 

What You’ll Do


Work with mechanical systems and production machinery data
Develop analytics solutions using Python and signal processing techniques (FFT, filters, etc.)
Assist in extracting insights from machine data to improve efficiency and performance
Collaborate with engineers to enhance data-driven decision-making


Must-haves 


Knowledge of mechanical systems  
Understanding of production machinery
Python 
Signal Processing (FFT, Filters, etc.) 


Nice to have


Software Engineering Fundamentals
SQL


What’s in it for you?   


Being a young company it’s all about the people - we’re a bunch of passionate and driven people with whom you will have a great time.   
Psychological safety and internal trust - flexible working hours, high expectations combined with a humane approach to work/life balance.  
Flat organization - we hire you because we believe in you. So challenge what we take for granted, express yourself and wear what you always dreamed of wearing to work, have fun, participate and make this the company you always dreamed of working for. 


How To Apply   

Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

About IPercept

Imagine knowing the mechanical health of a machine without touching it, being alerted well in advance before something breaks, understanding how a machine is truly being used, and identifying what needs attention on a component level before visiting the machine.

At IPercept, we make this possible. Our insights help manufacturers understand their machines’ true state and usage throughout the machine life-cycle, achieving a 30% increase in efficiency. This quick ROI is realized by minimizing downtime, enhancing productivity, and reducing scrap rates, tooling costs, maintenance parts, and energy consumption.

In just two years, over 20 of Europe’s largest manufacturers have trusted us, and none have looked back.

We look forward to seeing your application!

/ IPercept Team

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med 2-5 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

Rollbeskrivning:

Bakgrund

Sedan maj 2024 så finns en enhet hos kund som sysslar specifikt med s.k. Anläggningsanalys: datadrivet arbete för att besvara förvaltnings- och underhållsfrågor. Enheten jobbar mot flera olika beställare, både inom och utanför kund. Leveranserna som enheten producerar utgörs exempelvis av sammanställd statistik, analysmaterial eller dataverktyg.

För att få den tänkta utvecklingstakten behövs resurser som både kan utföra analyser tillsammans med sakkunniga och öka tillgängligheten för data för verksamheten i stort. Här är enheten Anläggningsanalys och även du som konsult väldigt viktig genom drivandet av diverse utvecklingsprojekt för verksamheten.

Arbetsuppgifter

Arbete med kodning och dataframställning i Power BI DAX och SQL
Att skapa intuitiva och tydliga visualisering i Power BI som besvarar beställarens frågor
Att samla in, tolka och skapa verktyg genom dialog med olika intressenter av data i verksamheten
Att välja lämpliga statistiska eller ML-algoritmer för de byggda modellerna
Kodning i Python kan förekomma i vissa projekt
Kunna redogöra för begränsningar och val som gjorts i de datamodeller som skapas
Att noggrant dokumentera det arbete som gjorts

Arbete sker typiskt sett i små grupper om 2 - 3 personer som driver ett visst utvecklingsprojekt.

Målet för många utvecklingsprojekt är att skapa Power BI rapporter som skickas för produktionssättning i kundens system och därigenom göra det tillgängligt för många intressenter samt beställare samtidigt.

Obligatoriska krav

Utbildning:

Masterexamen från högskola/universitet (120 hp) inom data- och systemvetenskap. Alternativt en masterexamen (120 hp) inom matematik, elkraft eller energi med minst 30 hp inom data och programmering.

Kompetens och erfarenhet:

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Power BI
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom projekt med dataanalys och datavisualisering
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att planera, leda och samordna framtagning av krav på system eller data för systemutveckling.

Mervärdeskrav

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från energibranschen.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbetsorderhantering, anläggningsförvaltning eller annan relevant erfarenhet av IFS eller UBW eller liknande affärssystem.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av kodning i Python
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet med versionshantering




Ansökan

Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

Arbetsplats och kultur

Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.

Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

Show more

Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.

Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

Title: Data Scientist - Image Analysis & Software Development
Description:
The role

We are seeking a skilled data scientist or image analyst with expertise in developing image analysis pipelines and software solutions to join our R&D team. The successful candidate will focus on the development and optimization of our image analysis pipeline, transforming raw microscope images into high-quality, quantitative biological data.

Working closely with the software team, this role will also contribute to enhancing Hyperplex PCR™ assays by refining how numerical results and quality metrics are visualized, ensuring a seamless, intuitive, and user-friendly software experience. The position is ideal for an action-driven problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced start-up environment and enjoys working at the intersection of data science, software development, and molecular diagnostics.




Responsibilities

Develop and refine image analysis modules to extract reproducible, quantitative results from microscopy images, including tasks such as 2D/3D feature segmentation, signal intensity analysis, spectral unmixing, and deconvolution.
Conduct systematic performance evaluations of image analysis pipelines and develop quality control metrics for datasets and experiments.
Automate and optimize software pipelines to improve computational efficiency, robustness, and scalability in high-throughput environments.
Design and integrate user-friendly interfaces (UI) for seamless interaction with image analysis tools and visualization of experiment results, including figures, tables, plots and images.
Maintain rigorous documentation of algorithms, software components, and experimental workflows.
Work closely with the R&D, bioassay, and service teams to balance performance and quality between assays and image analysis.
Maintain project timelines, document results, and communicate findings effectively.
Contribute to risk management activities to ensure smooth project execution.




Skills & Requirements

We’re looking for a candidate with a strategic mindset, action-driven approach, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and agile environment. This individual should possess meticulous attention to detail and a proactive approach to achieving project milestones, as well as the flexibility to adapt to evolving methods. The ideal candidate can communicate effectively at all organizational levels, build strong relationships with customers, and demonstrate a genuine passion for enabling new technologies with software. The candidate does not need to be proficient in biology, chemistry of physics, but preferably enjoys to learn about these subjects.

Required:

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Biomedical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and relevant libraries such as OpenCV, scikit-image, NumPy, and SciPy.
Strong skills in data visualization, statistical analysis, and quality control.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Valid work authorization for Sweden.

Preferred:

Strong proficiency in Python and key scientific libraries, including NumPy, scikit-image, scikit-learn, and OpenCV.
Skilled in statistical analysis, including data classification, regression, and clustering.
Proficient in data visualization using tools such as HoloViz, Plotly, Matplotlib or equivalent
Experience in GPU programming for high-performance image processing applications.
Expertise in deep learning model development, including architecting, training, and fine-tuning models for object detection and semantic segmentation.
Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration.
Industry experience in software development, with a focus on life sciences and medical applications, including UI development utilizing D3.js, Vue.js, React.js, or similar technologies .
Strong expertise in image processing and analysis, particularly in fluorescence microscopy.
Experience in bioinformatics, molecular diagnostics, or in situ analysis.




What we offer

An ambitious, innovative, inclusive and professional environment.
Being part of building a cross-disciplinary technology at the frontier of its space.
Primarily working on-site rather than remote to interact heavily with the R&D and Product teams.
Nordic level salary with 5 weeks annual paid vacation.
Stock option program.




Terms of employment

This is a 1 year full-time salary position available immediately, that can lead to full-time employment. The position is based on site in Aplex Bio’s facility on KI campus.




Application

Apply through: https://emp.jobylon.com/jobs/261709-aplex-bio-data-scientist-image-analysis-software-development/

Show more

Title: Energy Management – ML Engineer
Description:
Om tjänsten

You will work as part of a team responsible for developing production ready solutions in control, steering and optimisation of flex assets; and in bringing these solutions to successful business implementation and customer operation.

In broad terms this position is responsible for core feature maintenance, monitoring and development of predictive algorithms, as well as data modelling, feature testing and performance evaluation, dashboard creations, data cleaning and insights generations.

Your primary responsibilities are to;


Maintain & develop architecture for processing data in Azure data pipelines via Azure Databricks; Develop models & versioning using ML.
Manage & deploy Azure Databricks inference notebooks and infrastructure for continuous retraining of machine learning models.
Maintain & backup Databricks workspace and associated Data Lake environment.
Second line support i.e. monitoring of forecast models and alarm/ dashboard development & integration into existing Platform Dashboards.
Report & manage workload via Azure DevOps environment.
Monitoring of operational costs, performance and computational requirements via Azure, to ensure a scalable and reliable system.


Din bakgrund

We are looking for an outstanding candidate to join our Energy Management team to secure our in-house competence as a Machine Learning Engineer. To suceed in this role a few years of relevant work experience are required.

Education;


Master of science degree in a quantitative field, e.g., applied engineering; computer science; data science (or similar).


Work experience;

Key techniques, methods & processes that you must be grounded in include;


Azure Cloud Services; Azure Functions; Azure DevOps
Data Engineering
Git
ML algorithms
MLOps
Python Programming


Experience and demonstrable knowledge in the following would be a benefit,


Electrical engineering, power electronics, power systems
Optimisation theory (especially linear programming) & applied methods
Azure Databricks Delta Lake with Spark; Unity Catalogue
Building Azure pipelines for automatic deployments
Creating Azure functions with APIs for callable endpoints.
Experience in creating installable Python packages
Automatic deployments of GIT repos to Azure Functions
OpenAPI specification & Swagger; FastAPI web framework
MongoDB


Meritorious;


Certified or Accredited professional qualifications
A portfolio of developer work


Language;

Fluent in English; proficiency in Swedish is considered a plus

Personal profile;


As a person you are analytical, inquisitive, committed and self-driven with proven communication and interpersonal skills; You take ownership and pride in successful customer implementation and support in first commercial operation; You innovate regarding new ways of working and in developing our technical frameworks.


Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Stockholm, Solna

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Dag Wästlund Data Science & AI, +46 725 67 84 92. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Johanna Kollander +46 70 220 92 88

Trade Union representatives in Sweden via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.

Christer Gustafsson,ledarna, christer.gustafsson2@vattenfall.com,

Juha Siipilehto juha.siipilehto@vattenfall.com,

Christel Karlsson christel.karlsson@vattenfall.com.

We welcome your application in English no later than 27:th of april. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website and that you refrain from submitting a cover letter with your application. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

Do you want to be a key player in taking Vattenfall forward in the emerging energy landscape?

The energy sector is undergoing revolutionary change. Digitalization and the Internet of Things opens business opportunities in new Flex solutions, such as integration of customer flex assets e.g., stationary batteries, EV charging infrastructure, facility heating, PV inverters; as well as interaction with assets on the distribution grid.

Using innovative solutions, Vattenfall R&D has group-wide responsibility for conducting business driven technical development that supports the company’s strategic focus areas.

We offer you a flexible work environment where you will have the freedom to be creative, work and develop in an exciting and rapidly changing technical field of strategic importance to the company.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, II
Description:
The Personalization team makes decisions about what to play next easier and more enjoyable for every listener. From Blend to Discover Weekly, we’re behind some of Spotify’s most-loved features. We built them by understanding the world of music and podcasts better than anyone else. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening by making great recommendations to each and every one of them.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer II to join our product area of hardworking engineers that are passionate about connecting new and emerging creators with users via recommendation algorithms. As an integral part of the squad, you will collaborate with engineers, research scientists and data scientists in prototyping and productizing state-of-the-art ML.

What You'll Do


Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s personalization products by hands-on ML development
Collaborate with a cross functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
Promote and role-model best practices of ML systems development, testing, evaluation, etc., both inside the team as well as throughout the organization
Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in Europe (and across Spotify) collaborating with one another
Together with a wide range of collaborators, help develop a creator-first vision and strategy that keeps Spotify at the forefront of innovation in the field.


Who You Are


You have a strong background in machine learning, enjoy applying theory to develop real-world applications, with experience and expertise in bandit algorithms, LLMs, general neural networks, and/or other methods relevant to recommendation systems
You have hands-on experience implementing production machine learning systems at scale in Java, Scala, Python, or similar languages. Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc. is a strong plus
You have some experience with large scale, distributed data processing frameworks/tools like Apache Beam, Apache Spark, or even our open source API for it - Scio, and cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation
You love your customers even more than your code


Where You'll Be


We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the European region as long as we have a work location.
This team operates within the GMT/CET time zone for collaboration.


Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

If you're looking and would love to know more - drop me a DM on here - or email josh@randallrecruitment.com


Senior Python / Django Developer - Central Stockholm - 55,000 SEK - 70,000 SEK

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company

Truxel is a leading energy optimisation platform that leverages cutting-edge data and AI technology to enhance the efficiency of renewable energy systems. Our platform integrates various energy sources, including solar, wind, battery storage, and EV chargers, to deliver seamless energy optimisation.




Role Description

We seek a talented senior ML engineer to help us overcome the toughest challenges in the electricity market and make a meaningful impact. It is a contract position for an initial six months with the possibility of an extension. Below are a few responsibilities for this profile.

Perform data analysis and frame ML problem statements based on business requirements.
Perform time-series analysis and develop forecasting models.
Develop and implement mathematical optimisation solutions.
Develop anomaly detection, predictive maintenance tools and other advanced ML/AI solutions.
Deploy solutions to cloud infrastructure for near real-time predictions. (MLOps)




Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of industry experience with hands-on ML solution development.
Strong background in statistics and time-series forecasting solutions.
Experience with deep learning solutions for time series problems. (RL is a plus)
Experience with deploying models in cloud infrastructure.
Phthon, PyTorch & GCP/AWS.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.




Unfortunately, we do not offer sponsorship for this role.

The candidate must reside in Sweden.

Start ASAP.

Title: Senior AI Developer
Description:
Senior AI Developer – Prompt Engineering & AI-Agentutveckling




Vill du utveckla AI-lösningar i framkant och forma nästa generations intelligenta system? 

På Nordisk Ai får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla skalbara, affärskritiska AI-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för företag.

Vi söker en Senior AI Developer med expertis inom prompt engineering och AI-agentutveckling. Rollen är perfekt för dig som har en djup teknisk förståelse för stora språkmodeller (LLMs) och erfarenhet av att bygga, optimera och implementera AI-drivna system.




Om Nordisk Ai

På Nordisk Ai gör vi AI enkelt för alla. Vi hjälper företag att förstå, implementera och dra nytta av AI utan onödig komplexitet. Genom att kombinera avancerad teknik med en användarvänlig approach skapar vi innovativa AI-lösningar som ger företag en konkurrensfördel.

Vi är en snabbväxande startup där innovation, samarbete och teknisk expertis står i centrum. Vi jobbar i gränslandet mellan AI-forskning och affärsnytta, och nu söker vi en senior utvecklare som vill vara med och ta Nordisk AI till nästa nivå.




Om rollen

Som Senior AI Developer hos Nordisk AI får du en central roll i vårt AI-team. Du kommer att arbeta med att utveckla, optimera och implementera AI-drivna agenter och avancerade AI-lösningar.

Detta är en strategisk och tekniskt avancerad roll där du får stor frihet och möjlighet att påverka AI-utvecklingen hos både Nordisk AI och våra kunder.




Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:

Strategi och utveckling – Driva utvecklingen av AI-drivna agenter för automatisering och affärsprocesser.
Prompt engineering & optimering – Skapa och finjustera prompts för att förbättra precision, relevans och svarstid i LLM-modeller.
Modellutveckling & AI-optimering – Träna, finjustera och optimera AI-modeller för specifika användningsområden.
AI-arkitektur & systemintegration – Implementera och integrera AI-lösningar i tekniska ekosystem.
MLOps & deployment – Sätta upp CI/CD-pipelines och hantera drift av AI-modeller i molnmiljöer.
Tekniskt ledarskap – Vara en expert inom AI och NLP, dela kunskap och vägleda team inom AI-strategi och best practices.




Vi söker dig som:

Har en relevant utbildning eller gedigen erfarenhet inom AI.
Har minst 2-5 års erfarenhet av AI-utveckling, LLM, NLP eller maskininlärning.
Har god förståelse för GPT-4, Claude, Gemini eller andra LLM-modeller.
Har djup kunskap inom prompt engineering och erfarenhet av att optimera språkmodeller.
Har stark programmeringskunskap och erfarenhet av relevanta AI-ramverk.
Har erfarenhet av att bygga AI-drivna applikationer och konversationsagenter.
Är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift (krav).




Meriterande:

Tidigare erfarenhet från startup-miljö och B2B-projekt.
Kunskap inom WordPress, MemberPress och andra ledande AI-modeller.




Varför Nordisk Ai?

Teknisk innovation – Vi arbetar med den senaste AI-tekniken och experimenterar kontinuerligt med LLM, reinforcement learning och AI-automatisering.
Frihet att påverka – Som senior AI-utvecklare får du stor teknisk frihet att välja verktyg, sätta riktlinjer och påverka vår AI-strategi.
Snabbväxande team – Vi är en agil och snabbfotad organisation där beslut fattas snabbt och idéer snabbt omsätts i handling.
AI på riktigt – Vi jobbar inte bara med AI som en trend, utan som en affärskritisk funktion för våra kunder.
Entreprenöriell anda – Nytänkande och experimentlusta är en naturlig del av vår vardag.




Hos oss får du:

Stort inflytande – Du är med och formar våra produkter, vår tech-stack och vår övergripande AI-strategi.
Flexibelt arbetssätt – Vi erbjuder hybridlösning med möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
Snabbhet & innovation – Vi är en snabbfotad organisation där idéer snabbt kan bli verklighet, och där experimenterande är en självklar del av vardagen.
Ett dedikerat team – Du jobbar tillsammans med andra experter i ett tight, kunnigt och engagerat team där alla brinner för AI på riktigt.




Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens AI-lösningar med verklig påverkan? Då har vi plats för dig.




Så ansöker du

Är du redo att bygga nästa generations AI-agenter?




Skicka in din ansökan med CV och en kort beskrivning om vem du är som person.

Plats: Stockholm (eller remote för rätt kandidat).

Start: Enligt överenskommelse.

Anställningsform: Heltid, tillsvidare.

Urval sker löpande, ansök så snart som möjligt.




Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.

Välkommen till Nordisk Ai – där vi gör AI enkelt för alla.




Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Vill du arbeta med modern AI-teknik som generativ AI och maskininlärning, i kombination med molnteknologier som Microsoft Azure? Vi söker en passionerad AI Engineer som vill vara med från ett tidigt skede och forma innovativa lösningar för kollektivtrafiken i Stockholm. I rollen som AI engineer hos oss blir du del av ett team som arbetar med den senaste tekniken inom AI och dataanalys. Här får du chansen att arbeta brett, utforska ny teknik och skapa tydlig samhällsnytta.

Om oss

Hos oss på trafikförvaltningen får du jobba med starka varumärken som SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänst i Region Stockholm och Spårvägsmuseet.

Tillsammans ansvarar vi för halva Sveriges kollektivtrafik och vi har höga ambitioner. Vi utvecklar en av världens mest hållbara och attraktiva kollektivtrafik. vi jobbar dagligen med att minska vår miljöpåverkan, öka social hållbarhet och ansvarfullt förvalta våra gemensamma medel. Utan oss stannar Stockholm.

Om rollen

Som AI Engineer hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt nybildade AI-team. Du kommer att utveckla moderna AI-lösningar från idé till färdig produkt och driva både infrastruktur och modellutveckling i molnmiljö.

Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter:


Bygga, implementera och underhålla robust infrastruktur och pipelines för AI-lösningar, främst i Azure.
Driva operationalisering av AI-modeller med fokus på stabil drift, automatisering och skalbarhet (MLOps).
Delta i utveckling av prediktiva modeller och generativa AI tillämpningar i samarbete med verksamheten och data scientists.
Proaktivt utforska ny teknik och verktyg för effektivisering och kvalitetsförbättring av AI-arbetet.
Kommunicera tydligt och pedagogiskt med interna intressenter och tekniska team kring lösningarnas funktion och nytta.


För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du:

Vi söker dig som har ett starkt driv och ärresultatorienterad- Vidare har du en god kommunikationsförmåga och förmågan att kunna samarbeta effektivt med olika team. I rollen krävs det att du har ett genuint intresse för att lära dig nya tekniker och kontinuerligt utvecklas samt drivs av att lösa tekniska utmaningar och praktiska problem.

Krav:


Civilingenjörsutbildning (eller motsvarande) med relevant inriktning, exempelvis datateknik, data science, teknisk fysik, statistik eller matematik.
Erfarenhet av att implementera och förvalta AI- och ML-lösningar mha molnteknologier.
Ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet av programmering i python, inklusive bibliotek för datahantering, maskininlärning och AI (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow etc)
Kunskap om AI-algoritmer och metoder (supervised/unsupervised, deep learning, generativ AI)
Kunskap inom någon stor molnplattform (Azure, AWS eller GCP) för utveckling och drift av AI-lösningar
Kunskap inom SQL och Git


Meriterande:


Infrastruktur och automatisering av maskininlärning (MLOps), såsom MLFlow
Docker
Datavisualiseringsverktyg som Power BI eller Tableau
Spark och PySpark
Nätverksinfrastruktur
Kubernetes, AWS ECS/ Azure Container Instances, Openshift eller liknande
Agila arbetsmetoder (Scrum, Kanban)
DevOps eller MLOps för on-premise-lösningar
Infrastructure as Code, såsom Terraform


Det här erbjuder vi dig

Trafikförvaltningen befinner sig i en spännande förändringsresa där AI och data spelar en central roll. Vi söker dig som trivs med att bygga upp något nytt från grunden, utforska nya arbetssätt och forma en modern, datadriven organisation. Hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i ett team där det finns utrymme att påverka och skapa verklig förändring.

På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!

Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.

Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Eva Gunnarsson, tfn 0707863572. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Charlotte Sujeebun Olofsson, tfn 0707863222.

Ansök redan i dag eftersom intervjuer kan ske löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är 18 april. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).

Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.

Webb och sociala medier

För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida. Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn.

Nyckelord: AI, AI-Engineer, machine learning, generativ AI, molnteknik, MLOps, kollektivtrafik

Title: Analytiker
Description:
Är du student i slutskedet av din kandidat- eller masterutbildning och söker ett utvecklande extrajobb? Är du vass på att samla information & redovisa den? Vill du testa på något nytt?




Vi på Stellar erbjuder nämligen en unik möjlighet att hjälpa oss med dataanalys och research inom olika projekt. 




Om oss

Stellar accelererar företags lönsamhet genom digital marknadsföring. Från första kontraktet till lojala kunder – vi är med genom hela kundresan. För första gången samlar vi spetskompetenser inom CRM, analys, kreativt innehåll och försäljning under ett och samma tak. Våra experter samarbetar tillsammans för att attrahera, konvertera och bygga långsiktig kundlojalitet.  




Om rollen

Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med varierande projekt vid behov tillsammans med våra analytiker. Arbetsuppgifterna kan exempelvis inkludera:

Analys och sammanställning av insikter från intervjudata.
Beräkning av kundbasens livstidsvärde.
Implementering av maskininlärningsmodeller för att förutse marknadstrender.
Analys av marknadsresearch.
Skapande av nya datakällor och databaser utifrån kundens behov, exempelvis genom intervjuer och research.




Kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har:

Erfarenhet av programmering med fokus på statistisk analys (ex. Python, R, Matlab)
Kompetens inom dataanalys och paketering i Office-paketet (Excel, PowerPoint)
Erfarenhet av databashantering (ex. AWS, BigQuery) och analys i verktyg som Power BI, Azure, Qlik och Google Analytics
Kunskap om avancerade matematiska modeller, statistiska metoder och datahantering
Förmåga att identifiera mönster i stora datamängder, formulera hypoteser och visualisera insikter med relevanta metoder och modeller.




Anställningen

Anställningen är kontraktsbaserad, och projekt fördelas utifrån efterfrågan.




Ansökan

Låter detta intressant? Ansök nu! Vi rekryterar löpande. 




Frågor?

Mejla oss på hello@wearestellar.se återkopplar vi inom kort. 




Med vänliga hälsningar,

Team Stellar

Show more
