We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.

Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that the candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.

The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application Deadline

As soon as possible

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.

Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?


Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.


Who are you ideally?


You have a couple of years of experience in applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You have proficient programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.).
You have experience working with SQL, cloud platforms, and big data frameworks (Spark, etc.).
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.
Experience with Generative AI is a plus.


Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're truly interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.

Primary Responsibilities


Design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products.
Apply machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analytics to solve real world business challenges for our customers.
Work with large-scale datasets to generate insights and detect anomalies for fleet optimization.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate data solutions into our applications.


Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.


Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!


Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.

We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.

The question is: Are you in?
Show more

Title: Machine Learning developer with DSP experience (Python/C++)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Signal Processing and Machine Learning? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team!

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, and the Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, fusing the radar signal with information from video feeds and other sensors.

You will play a significant role in the development of our world-leading, proprietary golf and baseball sensor technology, which is now also being applied in football and many other sports. You will have the opportunity to do your own research and development work, and to see the direct impact of it.

In the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team we seek to expand the use of machine learning and you will play a significant role in including neural networks in our tracking software.

Responsibilities:


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.


Requirements


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Machine learning and neural networks
Digital Signal Processing (DSP)


Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills


Responsibilities


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments


We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

We offer:


Highly skilled colleagues
Career growth inside trackman
International environment with more than 35 nationalities in our HQ
Working with the leading golf technology brand in the industry
Social activities


Are you our new colleague?

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

In the radar tracking & signal processing team we value teamwork and openness. Therefore, we expect you to enjoy working with other highly motivated colleagues and help provide a good working environment. We do not expect that you can be an expert on every aspect of being a developer, but rather strive to improve and learn together with the team.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology.

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our new headquarter located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo.  We employ more than 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where all hardware and most software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At TrackMan, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes TrackMan an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application including and your diploma as soon as possible to join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. Working place for this position is at Trackman Innovation Center in Hørsholm, our new HQ building. Contact Troels Bastholm at troels@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Currently hiring for a September 2025 start date.




Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
twoday er den førende digitale transformationspartner i Nordeuropa med en global tilstedeværelse. Med cirka 3.000 teknologer samarbejder vi med de mest beundrede private og offentlige organisationer for at levere banebrydende digitale løsninger. Vores dybe brancheekspertise omfatter Data & AI, softwareudvikling, digitale oplevelser og forretningsapplikationer. Vores team, der opererer i hele Norden og Litauen, genererede en omsætning på 280 millioner euro i 2023. Vi betjener over 8.000 kunder og understøtter deres digitale transformationsrejser.

Vi søger ekstraordinære Data Scientists!

Er du på hjemmebane i Python, og ønsker du at arbejde målrettet med Machine Learning, LLM-applikationer og cloud teknologi for nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder og organisationer?

Har du ambitioner om at udvikle løsninger, der flytter grænserne for, hvad danske virksomheder kan opnå med data og AI/ML i produktion? Så har vi muligvis den helt rigtige stilling til dig.

twoday Data & AI er førende inden for AI, Azure og Business Intelligence. Vi arbejder med nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder, hvor faglighed og integritet sættes først. Vi er i rivende vækst og tæller i dag 200 medarbejdere på 4 kontorer og er en del af twoday-koncernen med mere end 3.000 dygtige IT-konsulenter.

Vi lever og ånder for at omsætte data til konkret forretningsværdi med innovative løsninger. Det kan vi, fordi vi dækker hele værdikæden fra de første strategiske spadestik til etablering af dataplatform til udvikling og implementering af AI-løsninger - og fordi vi går efter at tiltrække og fastholde de skarpeste profiler.

Om Stillingen

Som Senior Data Scientist i twoday bliver du en del af vores voksende AI-team, hvor vi sammen deler passionen for at se vores AI-applikationer skabe reel værdi for slutbrugerne. Du vil passe godt i teamet, hvis du ligesom os er:


Passioneret for, hvordan data, generativ AI og ML kan anvendes til at løse kundernes forretningsproblemer og realisere forretningspotentialer
Ivrig efter at lære endnu mere om produktionsklar kode, skalerbare data science-løsninger, deployment pipelines og MLOps
Selvkørende og stræber efter faglige udfordringer hver dag
Vild med at dele ud af din viden og formår at omsætte teknisk fagligt stof til forskellige brugertyper
Opsat på at følge projekter fra start til slut, sparre med kunder og kolleger om løsninger undervejs samt give input til forankring i forretningen og hos slutbrugerne


Om Dig


Du har en bred forståelse for data science-discipliner og en holdning til, hvor de kan skabe værdi i praksis
Du har dyb indsigt i ét eller flere områder som f.eks. NLP, computer vision, predictive maintenance, fraud detection, churn analytics eller interpretable AI
Du har mindst 4 års erfaring med data science og har haft berøring med at produktionssætte data science-løsninger
Du arbejder struktureret, sætter pris på at arbejde i teams og tager ansvar for at dokumentere dit arbejde, så andre kan bruge det
Du har erfaring med cloud-teknologier og er nysgerrig på mere
Du er vant til at arbejde med GIT og kender til CI/CD pipelines og unit testing
Du skal være selvstændig og have lyst til at være konsulent


Særlige fordele ved at arbejde som Data Scientist i twoday:


Vi har førende eksperter inden for det meste med data - så du kan koncentrere dig om at blive den bedste inden for dit felt
Vi har et stærkt team af Senior Data Scientists og Data Science Engineers, der kommer fra stillinger som team leads. Det betyder et tårnhøjt fagligt niveau, og at alle har nogen, de kan lære af
Vi er tunge på Enterprise AI, Deployment og MLOps. Det gør, at du også kommer til at se værdien af de løsninger, du udvikler
Vi har branchens fedeste AI- og generative AI-projekter. Intet mindre
Vi tror på, at arbejdslivet er bedst, når der er plads til ’the rest’. Hos os kan du faktisk være konsulent uden at arbejde solen sort


Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

twoday er placeret i moderne lokaler på 30 steder i Norge, Sverige, Danmark, Finland og Litauen. Vi har et stærkt og unikt socialt miljø med højt engagerede medarbejdere. Hvis du er den kandidat, vi leder efter, vil du få en central rolle med spændende muligheder for at udvikle dig i en international og innovativ gruppe, med spændende produkter og tjenester inden for teknologi og software. Du vil også have fleksibiliteten til at "jumpe" og arbejde fra et af vores hovedkontorer i Oslo, Stockholm, København, Helsinki eller Vilnius til tider.

Diversitet og inklusion

Opfylder du ikke alle kravene? Hos twoday er vi dedikerede til at opbygge en arbejdsplads og et fællesskab, hvor alle er velkomne. Hvis du er begejstret for denne rolle, men din tidligere erfaring ikke præcist matcher jobbeskrivelsen, opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at ansøge.

Er du interesseret?

Så send din ansøgning i dag, de vil løbende blive læst.

Der vil løbende blive indkaldt til indledende samtaler. Du ansøger ved at klikke på knappen nedenfor.  Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er Ann Brahe-Orlandi, Talent Acquisition Manager, klar til at hjælpe. Hun glæder sig til at høre fra dig på ann.brahe-orlandi@twoday.com.
Show more
HTML:
twoday er den førende digitale transformationspartner i Nordeuropa med en global tilstedeværelse. Med cirka 3.000 teknologer samarbejder vi med de mest beundrede private og offentlige organisationer for at levere banebrydende digitale løsninger. Vores dybe brancheekspertise omfatter Data & AI, softwareudvikling, digitale oplevelser og forretningsapplikationer. Vores team, der opererer i hele Norden og Litauen, genererede en omsætning på 280 millioner euro i 2023. Vi betjener over 8.000 kunder og understøtter deres digitale transformationsrejser.

Vi søger ekstraordinære Data Scientists!

Er du på hjemmebane i Python, og ønsker du at arbejde målrettet med Machine Learning, LLM-applikationer og cloud teknologi for nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder og organisationer?

Har du ambitioner om at udvikle løsninger, der flytter grænserne for, hvad danske virksomheder kan opnå med data og AI/ML i produktion? Så har vi muligvis den helt rigtige stilling til dig.

twoday Data & AI er førende inden for AI, Azure og Business Intelligence. Vi arbejder med nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder, hvor faglighed og integritet sættes først. Vi er i rivende vækst og tæller i dag 200 medarbejdere på 4 kontorer og er en del af twoday-koncernen med mere end 3.000 dygtige IT-konsulenter.

Vi lever og ånder for at omsætte data til konkret forretningsværdi med innovative løsninger. Det kan vi, fordi vi dækker hele værdikæden fra de første strategiske spadestik til etablering af dataplatform til udvikling og implementering af AI-løsninger - og fordi vi går efter at tiltrække og fastholde de skarpeste profiler.

Om Stillingen

Som Senior Data Scientist i twoday bliver du en del af vores voksende AI-team, hvor vi sammen deler passionen for at se vores AI-applikationer skabe reel værdi for slutbrugerne. Du vil passe godt i teamet, hvis du ligesom os er:

  • Passioneret for, hvordan data, generativ AI og ML kan anvendes til at løse kundernes forretningsproblemer og realisere forretningspotentialer
  • Ivrig efter at lære endnu mere om produktionsklar kode, skalerbare data science-løsninger, deployment pipelines og MLOps
  • Selvkørende og stræber efter faglige udfordringer hver dag
  • Vild med at dele ud af din viden og formår at omsætte teknisk fagligt stof til forskellige brugertyper
  • Opsat på at følge projekter fra start til slut, sparre med kunder og kolleger om løsninger undervejs samt give input til forankring i forretningen og hos slutbrugerne

Om Dig

  • Du har en bred forståelse for data science-discipliner og en holdning til, hvor de kan skabe værdi i praksis
  • Du har dyb indsigt i ét eller flere områder som f.eks. NLP, computer vision, predictive maintenance, fraud detection, churn analytics eller interpretable AI
  • Du har mindst 4 års erfaring med data science og har haft berøring med at produktionssætte data science-løsninger
  • Du arbejder struktureret, sætter pris på at arbejde i teams og tager ansvar for at dokumentere dit arbejde, så andre kan bruge det
  • Du har erfaring med cloud-teknologier og er nysgerrig på mere
  • Du er vant til at arbejde med GIT og kender til CI/CD pipelines og unit testing
  • Du skal være selvstændig og have lyst til at være konsulent

Særlige fordele ved at arbejde som Data Scientist i twoday:

  • Vi har førende eksperter inden for det meste med data - så du kan koncentrere dig om at blive den bedste inden for dit felt
  • Vi har et stærkt team af Senior Data Scientists og Data Science Engineers, der kommer fra stillinger som team leads. Det betyder et tårnhøjt fagligt niveau, og at alle har nogen, de kan lære af
  • Vi er tunge på Enterprise AI, Deployment og MLOps. Det gør, at du også kommer til at se værdien af de løsninger, du udvikler
  • Vi har branchens fedeste AI- og generative AI-projekter. Intet mindre
  • Vi tror på, at arbejdslivet er bedst, når der er plads til ’the rest’. Hos os kan du faktisk være konsulent uden at arbejde solen sort

Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

twoday er placeret i moderne lokaler på 30 steder i Norge, Sverige, Danmark, Finland og Litauen. Vi har et stærkt og unikt socialt miljø med højt engagerede medarbejdere. Hvis du er den kandidat, vi leder efter, vil du få en central rolle med spændende muligheder for at udvikle dig i en international og innovativ gruppe, med spændende produkter og tjenester inden for teknologi og software. Du vil også have fleksibiliteten til at "jumpe" og arbejde fra et af vores hovedkontorer i Oslo, Stockholm, København, Helsinki eller Vilnius til tider.

Diversitet og inklusion

Opfylder du ikke alle kravene? Hos twoday er vi dedikerede til at opbygge en arbejdsplads og et fællesskab, hvor alle er velkomne. Hvis du er begejstret for denne rolle, men din tidligere erfaring ikke præcist matcher jobbeskrivelsen, opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at ansøge.

Er du interesseret?

Så send din ansøgning i dag, de vil løbende blive læst.

Der vil løbende blive indkaldt til indledende samtaler. Du ansøger ved at klikke på knappen nedenfor.  Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er Ann Brahe-Orlandi, Talent Acquisition Manager, klar til at hjælpe. Hun glæder sig til at høre fra dig på ann.brahe-orlandi@twoday.com.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

If you have questions, you are welcome to write to us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not submit your application to this email address as our hiring team will not have visibility.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hjælp verdens mest innovative virksomheder med at forbedre deres AI-modeller ved at give menneskelig feedback. Er du en erfaren matematikekspert, der gerne vil give din ekspertise til at træne AI-modeller?

Om Muligheden

Outlier søger en talentfuld matematikekspert til at hjælpe med at træne generative kunstig intelligens-modeller. Denne freelancemulighed er fjern, og arbejdstiden er fleksible, så du kan arbejde, når det passer dig bedst. Du kan bidrage med din ekspertise ved at...

Vurdering af faktualitet og relevans af domænespecifik tekst produceret af AI-modeller

Udarbejdelse og besvarelse af spørgsmål relateret til matematik

Evaluering og rangering af domænespecifikke svar genereret af AI-modeller

Eksempler På Ønskelig Ekspertise

En bachelor eller højere grad i matematik eller et beslægtet fag

Erfaring med at arbejde som matematikprofessionel

Evne til at skrive klart om begreber relateret til matematik på flydende engelsk og Dansk

Betaling

Priserne varierer baseret på ekspertise, kompetencevurdering, placering, projektbehov og andre faktorer. For eksempel kan højere takster tilbydes ph.d.er. For ikke-kernearbejde, såsom under indledende projektonboarding eller projektoverarbejde, kan lavere takster gælde. Visse projekter tilbyder incitamentsbetalinger. Gennemgå venligst betalingsbetingelserne for hvert projekt.

BEMÆRK VENLIGST: Vi indsamler, beholder og bruger personlige data til vores professionelle forretningsformål, herunder at underrette dig om muligheder, der kan være af interesse og dele med vores tilknyttede selskaber. Vi begrænser de personlige data, vi indsamler, til det, som vi mener er passende og nødvendigt for at håndtere ansøgeres behov, levere vores tjenester og overholde gældende love. Enhver information, vi indsamler i forbindelse med din ansøgning, vil blive behandlet i overensstemmelse med Outlier Privacy Policy og vores interne politikker og programmer designet til at beskytte personlige data.

Dette er en 1099 kontraktmulighed på Outlier.ai-platformen. Fordi dette er en freelance-mulighed, tilbyder vi ikke praktikpladser, sponsorater eller ansættelser. Du skal have tilladelse til at arbejde i dit bopælsland. Hvis du er international studerende, kan du muligvis tilmelde dig Outlier, hvis du er på visum. Du bør kontakte din skatte- og/eller immigrationsrådgiver med specifikke spørgsmål vedrørende dine forhold .

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…

  • Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
  • Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
  • Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
  • Can work both independently and as part of a team.

Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...

  • Python
  • PyTorch
  • C++
  • OpenCV
  • AWS
  • MLFlow
  • Kubernetes

We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...

  • Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
  • An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
  • Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
  • You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
  • Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
  • Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
  • Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.

Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!

The Mission Awaits

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.

Your Role As An Engineering Manager


Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.


Ideal Qualifications


Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.

Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?


Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we are committed to creating and contributing to an inclusive workplace. And this strategy starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.


Who are you ideally?


You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.


Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.

Primary Responsibilities


Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap


Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.


Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!


Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - an industry with a significant global influence. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.

We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.

The question is: Are you in?
Show more

Title: Projektingeniør - Nordjylland
Description:
Har du en passion for programmering af SCADA- og/eller PLC-applikationer? Og kan du se dig selv i et team, hvor samarbejde, sparring og godt humør vægtes højt?

Så er du måske vores nye kollega! Vi oplever høj kundetilfredshed og stor efterspørgsel og søger derfor lige nu en engageret projektingeniør til vores kontorer i Nordjylland.

Din nye hverdag som projektingeniør hos Init

Som Projektingeniør Hos Init Vil Du Udvikle Skræddersyede Løsninger Til Vores Kunder På Både Store Og Små Projekter. Du Vil Deltage i Alle Faser Af Projektet – Fra Det Indledende Kundemøde Til Implementering, Test Og Aflevering. Dine Arbejdsopgaver Vil Bl.a. Omfatte


Design, programmering og implementering af PLC- og/eller SCADA-styrede automationsløsninger.
Fejlfinding, vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende programmer og udstyr.
Tværfagligt samarbejde både internt og eksternt for at sikre succesfuld integration af dine automationsløsninger.
Udvikling og dokumentation af automationsstrategier og -procedurer.


Om dig 

Vi Forestiller Os, At Du Er Uddannet Ingeniør, Maskinmester, Automationsteknolog, Elektriker Eller Lignende Og Har Erfaring Med SCADA Og/eller PLC-programmering. Derudover Søger Vi Dig, Der


Er god til at kommunikere med både kolleger, kunder og leverandører.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt og struktureret med dine opgaver.
Er en holdspiller og en vellidt kollega, som forstår vigtigheden af at sparre og dele ud af din viden.


Hvorfor blive en del af Init?

Som Vores Nye Kollega Bliver Du En Del Af En Læringsorienteret Arbejdsplads Med En Nærværende Ledelse, Der Går Op i Din Trivsel Og Udvikling. Vi Tilbyder Bl.a. En Konkurrencedygtig Lønpakke, Attraktive Vilkår Og En Arbejdsplads, Hvor Du Vil Opleve


En afvekslende hverdag, hvor du bliver udfordret og ser konkrete resultater af dit arbejde.
Høj faglighed og spændende projekter inden for moderne teknologier.
Stor frihed til selv at tilrettelægge dit arbejde.
Et team af dygtige kolleger, som du kan sparre med i hverdagen


Lyder det som noget for dig? Så glæder vi os til at høre fra dig!

Du ansøger stillingen ved at udfylde formularen og uploade dit CV samt evt. en ansøgning.

Hvis du har spørgsmål eller blot er nysgerrig på at høre mere om rollen og Init, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte os.

Om Init

Du bliver en del af Init – en virksomhed i vækst, som har en ambition om at samle de bedste virksomheder og mennesker inden for Industriel IT og Automation. I dag er vi i Danmark ca. 450 medarbejdere fordelt på mere end 20 lokationer. Vi lægger vægt på at give dig et sjovt, sikkert og inkluderende arbejdsmiljø. Vores motto – ”We are Init together” – gælder både, når vi samarbejder med kolleger om at gøre Init til en attraktiv arbejdsplads, og når vi samarbejder med kunder for at forme fremtiden inden for Industriel IT og Automation.

Apply

Share in your network
Show more

Så er du måske vores nye kollega! Vi oplever høj kundetilfredshed og stor efterspørgsel og søger derfor lige nu en engageret projektingeniør til vores kontorer i Nordjylland.

Din nye hverdag som projektingeniør hos Init

Som Projektingeniør Hos Init Vil Du Udvikle Skræddersyede Løsninger Til Vores Kunder På Både Store Og Små Projekter. Du Vil Deltage i Alle Faser Af Projektet – Fra Det Indledende Kundemøde Til Implementering, Test Og Aflevering. Dine Arbejdsopgaver Vil Bl.a. Omfatte

  • Design, programmering og implementering af PLC- og/eller SCADA-styrede automationsløsninger.
  • Fejlfinding, vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende programmer og udstyr.
  • Tværfagligt samarbejde både internt og eksternt for at sikre succesfuld integration af dine automationsløsninger.
  • Udvikling og dokumentation af automationsstrategier og -procedurer.

Om dig 

Vi Forestiller Os, At Du Er Uddannet Ingeniør, Maskinmester, Automationsteknolog, Elektriker Eller Lignende Og Har Erfaring Med SCADA Og/eller PLC-programmering. Derudover Søger Vi Dig, Der

  • Er god til at kommunikere med både kolleger, kunder og leverandører.
  • Kan arbejde selvstændigt og struktureret med dine opgaver.
  • Er en holdspiller og en vellidt kollega, som forstår vigtigheden af at sparre og dele ud af din viden.

Hvorfor blive en del af Init?

Som Vores Nye Kollega Bliver Du En Del Af En Læringsorienteret Arbejdsplads Med En Nærværende Ledelse, Der Går Op i Din Trivsel Og Udvikling. Vi Tilbyder Bl.a. En Konkurrencedygtig Lønpakke, Attraktive Vilkår Og En Arbejdsplads, Hvor Du Vil Opleve

  • En afvekslende hverdag, hvor du bliver udfordret og ser konkrete resultater af dit arbejde.
  • Høj faglighed og spændende projekter inden for moderne teknologier.
  • Stor frihed til selv at tilrettelægge dit arbejde.
  • Et team af dygtige kolleger, som du kan sparre med i hverdagen

Lyder det som noget for dig? Så glæder vi os til at høre fra dig!

Du ansøger stillingen ved at udfylde formularen og uploade dit CV samt evt. en ansøgning.

Hvis du har spørgsmål eller blot er nysgerrig på at høre mere om rollen og Init, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte os.

Om Init

Du bliver en del af Init – en virksomhed i vækst, som har en ambition om at samle de bedste virksomheder og mennesker inden for Industriel IT og Automation. I dag er vi i Danmark ca. 450 medarbejdere fordelt på mere end 20 lokationer. Vi lægger vægt på at give dig et sjovt, sikkert og inkluderende arbejdsmiljø. Vores motto – ”We are Init together” – gælder både, når vi samarbejder med kolleger om at gøre Init til en attraktiv arbejdsplads, og når vi samarbejder med kunder for at forme fremtiden inden for Industriel IT og Automation.

Apply

Share in your network

Title: Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer, Tryg Privat
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi udvider vores forretningsorienterede Data Science & AI Modelling-team i Trygs privatforretning. Derfor søger vi nye kollegaer med baggrund som Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler. Vi leder efter personer med stærke kompetencer inden for modellering, machine learning, data og softwareudvikling, som også har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring udvikling, implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller for at optimere salg og styrke fastholdelsen af vores kunder.

Om rollen | Understøt kunderejsen i Tryg

I din nye rolle, vil du sammen med teamet udvikle full-stack løsninger, der typisk baserer sig på moderne anvendt statistik og machine learning-algoritmer. Du vil få berøring med flere dele af værdikæden, herunder at identificere behov, bygge business cases, etablere datagrundlag, modellere, implementere, monitorere og lave effektmålinger.

Mere konkret vil du og teamet arbejde med:


Churn-modellering og fastholdelse
Lead-generering og produktanbefaling
Optimering af salg, f.eks. "Next Best Offer" samt tilhørende databehandling og datamodellering samt opbygning af software-infrastruktur hertil.


Uanset din baggrund, får du mulighed for at præge dine arbejdsopgaver i en retning, hvor de skaber størst forretningsværdi og dine kompetencer udnyttes på bedste vis. Vi mener nemlig, at de bedste løsninger opstår i tæt samarbejde med forretningen. Derfor er en vigtig del af jobbet også at kommunikere direkte med stakeholders i forretningen for at forstå deres processer og udfordringer, så du kan hjælpe med at yde effektiv beslutningsstøtte og understøtte den gode kundeoplevelse.

Vores tech-stack inkluderer en række forskellige teknologier, som du vil arbejde med, heriblandt:


Virtuelle maskiner i Azure
Kafka, Mongo- og SQL-databaser
Docker og Kubernetes
En Python-baseret kodebase i Gitlab


Output fra vores løsninger distribueres typisk til produktionssystemer via web services. Vores analytiske platform er under løbende udvikling, hvilket betyder, at du skal være parat til at håndtere udfordringer inden for data, værktøjer og infrastruktur. Vi er dog godt på vej i den rigtige retning og ser frem til at fortsætte denne udvikling med din hjælp.

Om dig | Kompetent, erfaren og forretningsorienteret

Din baggrund kan både være som Data Scientist med erfaring i at bygge machine learning-applikationer i en forretningskontekst, eller som Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler med erfaring inden for data science området. Det vigtigste er, at du trives med forretningsdialog og besidder gode kommunikationskompetencer, så du kan formidle dine idéer og sikre en god forståelse mellem analyse og forretning. Derudover, har du en interesse i Trygs forretning, systemer og processer, da det kræver et godt domænekendskab for at kunne levere værdiskabende modeller og løsninger.

Vi forventer, at du har:


Stærke data- og modelleringskompetencer kombineret med et godt forretningsmindset
Praktisk erfaring med implementering af data pipelines og machine learning-modeller i produktion, og især i Engineer-rollen erfaring med at opbygge infrastruktur hertil.
Bred viden indenfor statistiske metoder, herunder machine learning-modeller, neurale netværk, boosting metoder, A/B-testing og overlevelsesanalyse især i Data Scientist-rollen.
En relevant uddannelsesbaggrund i machine learning, statistik, matematik, økonomi, datalogi, IT eller lignende.


Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har:


Erfaring med følgende sprog, pakker og værktøjer, som vi anvender: Python, SQL, NO-SQL, Gitlab, Kafka, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure, Linux, Cloud Computing, Webservices, Jupyterlab, PyTorch og Sci-kit Learn.
Interesse i GDPR, AI act, dataetik m.v. således at du kan sikre en stærk compliance i dit arbejde.


Da vi er ved at udvide teamet, har vi mulighed for at være fleksible med sammensætningen af kompetencer og profiler i teamet, så uddyb gerne hvilken del af profilen du brænder for og kan bidrage med.

Om os | Et stærkt analysemiljø

Du bliver en del af vores Data Science & AI Modelling-team, som er placeret tæt på forretningen i Technical Excellence i Trygs privatforretning. Foruden Data Science & AI Modelling består Technical Excellence af vores Portfolio Management- og Pricing teams, hvor vi har mange års erfaring med at arbejde med data og modeller i en forretningskontekst. Derudover bliver du en del af et stærkt fagligt netværk på tværs af Trygs forretningsområder.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Technical Excellence, Bjørn Sandqvist på bjoern.sandqvist@tryg.dk eller +45 21753879, eller leder af Data Science & AI Modelling afdelingen, Tobias Sommer Thune på tobias.thune@tryg.dk. Vi opfordrer dig til at søge hurtigst muligt, da vi afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når de rette kandidater er fundet.

Ansøgningsfrist: 18. april 2025.

Diversitet & inklusion skaber et stærkere Tryg

Vi mener, at mangfoldighed i tankegang er afgørende for vores fremtidige succes, og vi ønsker at afspejle det samfund, vi er en del af. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet på at sikre en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads, hvor du føler dig respekteret, kan være dig selv og har lige muligheder for at udvikle dig og gøre karriere.

Vi opfordrer derfor alle, uanset køn, alder, oprindelse eller baggrund, til at søge stillingen.

Læs mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde i Tryg

Sammen om din karriereudvikling

Hos Tryg har vi høj medarbejdertilfredshed og et stærkt tværfagligt miljø med gode karrieremuligheder. Udvikling og læring er en konstant proces hos os, og vi ønsker, at du vokser og udvikler dig sammen med os.

Uanset om du vil udvide dine faglige kompetencer, tage næste skridt i karrieren eller udforske nye områder, støtter vi dig på din udviklingsrejse.

Udforsk dine muligheder her

Er vores kendetegn også dine?

Vis tillid

Hos Tryg bygger vi på hinandens tillid, når vi bevæger os ud på ukendt grund som morgendagens tryghedsskaber. Vi tror på, at tillid og frihed under ansvar motiverer din nysgerrighed og dit mod til at gå nye veje. Du får ledere og kolleger, der lægger vægt på både trivsel og resultater.

Hos Tryg oplever du en kultur, der bygger på tillid, ansvar og udvikling hele vejen rundt..

Tag ansvar

Når du starter i Tryg, vil du hurtigt opdage, at ansvar er noget, der fylder. Jo mere ansvar, du vil have, jo mere får du, når du viser, at du kan leve op til det.

Her får du mandat til at udforske nye muligheder, koncepter og løsninger, der skaber tryghed for kunder, kollegaer og samfund i dag og i morgen.

Skab udvikling

I Tryg går du forrest og skaber udviklingen sammen med dine kolleger. Det kræver både mod, vilje og evnen til at gå nye veje. Her tør vi tage chancer, og det giver dig frihed til at forfølge dine idéer og skabe noget nyt.

Det giver store muligheder for dig, som kan, vil og tør sætte tryk på din egen og på Trygs udvikling.
Show more

Title: Projektingeniør - Storkøbenhavn
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du en passion for programmering af SCADA- og/eller PLC-applikationer? Trives du i et uformelt miljø, hvor godt kollegaskab og samarbejde er nøgleord? Og vil du være en del af et engageret automationsteam med gode udviklingsmuligheder?

Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter! Vi oplever høj kundetilfredshed og stor efterspørgsel, og har derfor brug for flere dygtige kolleger til vores kontorer i Storkøbenhavn.

Din nye hverdag som Projektingeniør i Init

Som vores nye Projektingeniør vil du arbejde med design, udvikling og implementering af PLC- og/eller SCADA-styrede automationsløsninger, som sikrer vores kunder bedre kontrol med deres anlæg. Du har mulighed for at deltage i alle faser af projektet – fra det indledende kundemøde til implementering, test og aflevering. Derudover udfører vi løbende fejlfinding, kontrol og optimering af vores kunders eksisterende anlæg.

Vi arbejder inden for forskellige forretningsområder – såsom miljø & energi, forsyning, pharma, industri, føde- og drikkevarereproduktion mv. Dine kompetencer og interesser afgør, hvilke af vores forretningsområder, du bedst vil kunne indgå i.

Hvem er du?

Vi Leder Efter Dig, Der Har En Baggrund Som Ingeniør, Maskinmester Eller Lignende, Og Vi Ser Gerne, At Du Har Erfaring Med SCADA-, HMI- Og/eller PLC-programmering. Derudover Vil Du Passe Perfekt Ind i Rollen Og i Init, Hvis Du


Er god til at kommunikere med kolleger, kunder og leverandører – både på dansk og engelsk.
Kan arbejde både selvstændigt og i teams og går struktureret til dine arbejdsopgaver.
Er en holdspiller og vellidt kollega, som forstår vigtigheden af at sparre og dele ud af viden.


Hvorfor skal du blive en del af Init?

Er Du Til Løb, Skitur Eller Vinaftener? Hos Os Vil Du Opleve Stor Variation - Både Når Det Kommer Til Arbejdsopgaver Og Sociale Arrangementer. Som Vores Nye Kollega Bliver Du En Del Af En Læringsorienteret Arbejdsplads, Som Går Op i Din Trivsel. Hos Os Vil Du Opleve


Gode muligheder for faglig og personlig udvikling.
En konkurrencedygtig lønpakke og god frokostordning.
Et team af dygtige kolleger, som du kan sparre med i hverdagen.
Gode muligheder for ansvar og indflydelse på projekterne – samt stor frihed til selv at tilrettelægge dit arbejde.
Et socialt fællesskab, hvor vi engagerer os i hinanden.


Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så glæder vi os til at høre fra dig! Du ansøger ved at udfylde ansøgningsformularen og uploade dit CV og eventuelt en ansøgning. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte os.

Hvem er vi?

Du bliver en del af Init – en førende leverandør inden for Industriel IT og Automation. I dag er vi i Danmark ca. 450 medarbejdere fordelt på mere end 20 lokationer. Vi lægger vægt på at give dig et sjovt, sikkert og inkluderende arbejdsmiljø. Vores motto – ”We are Init together” – gælder både, når vi samarbejder med kolleger om at gøre Init til en attraktiv arbejdsplads, og når vi samarbejder med kunder for at forme fremtiden indenfor Industriel IT og Automation. Title: Machine Learning Platform Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence and excited to work at the intersection of Cloud Infrastructure and cutting-edge ML/AI solutions in a fast paced business? This is your chance to embed with our Fundamental Modelling (FM) team, developing large-scale ML/AI models using and supplying terabytes of meteorological data to drive insights and competitive advantage in energy trading.




About the Role

We’re seeking a hands-on ML Platform Engineer to work directly with the Head of Fundamental Modelling as a strategic business partner, while reporting to the Manager of Cloud Development ensuring an anchor in the wider technical organization.

Your mission: Enable our FM and Quant Trading teams to focus entirely on sophisticated modelling and meteorology solutions by ensuring platform infrastructure and operations run seamlessly in the background.

You’ll help maintain and expand our hybrid infrastructure using Azure Cloud and on-premise high-performance computing (HPC) resources, ensuring the right balance of performance, agility, reliability and cost for each use case.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage the ML platform for large-scale data and complex ML models.
Implement MLOps best practices to streamline development and deployment.
Optimize the platform’s performance and efficiency across Azure Cloud and on-premise HPC.
Ensure smooth transition of ML and Big Data applications from development to production.
Proactively solve infrastructure issues and improve platform reliability.
Partner with data scientists and engineers to enable successful deployment and monitoring.
Drive platform improvements to meet business and technical needs.




We expect that you are familiar with several of the topics below and are ready to embrace learning the rest in your job with us!

Experience building and maintaining ML platforms in data-intensive environments.
Strong experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Expertise in GPU-based ML training and high-memory computing.
Experience with HPC infrastructure and cloud integration.
Ability to assess and recommend the best infrastructure solutions.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Experience with time-series or geospatial data is a plus.




Personal Competencies

Collaborative: You work well with data scientists and engineers to solve challenges together.
Business-driven: You seek to understand business needs and deliver effective solutions.
Proactive: You anticipate problems and address them before they escalate.
Customer-focused: You ensure the FM team can rely on the platform without friction.
Adaptable: You adjust strategies based on changing business and technical requirements.
Clear communicator: You explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Did we pique your interest?

Click the "APPLY" button - we are continuously looking for talented people to join our team.

Show more
