Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vil du arbejde med machine learning i et strategisk højt prioriteret miljø, hvor AI-udvikling er i fokus? Lederne søger en Senior Data Scientist, der vil tage del i at forme fremtidens AI-løsninger og samtidig fungere som teknisk sparringspartner for forretningen. Her får du frihed under ansvar, muligheden for at fordybe dig i de nyeste teknologier og et team af dygtige specialister, der deler din passion for data.




Hvem er vi?

Lederne er Danmarks største interesseorganisation og a-kasse for ledere. Vi er i gang med en digital transformation, hvor AI og data står centralt i at skabe de bedst mulige løsninger for vores mere end 135.000 medlemmer. Eksempelvis har vi allerede udviklet flere AI-baserede værktøjer, der bygger på kendte LLMs.




Din rolle som Senior Data Scientist

Som Senior Data Scientist hos Lederne får du en nøglerolle i at:

Designe, udvikle og drifte vores ML-platform og AI og automatiserings-løsninger.
Tage ejerskab over og definere retningen for, hvordan vi arbejder med AI efter best practice.
Opdage nye forretningsmuligheder i tæt samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af organisationen.




Du får altså en bred rolle, hvor du både koder, drifter og udvikler modeller og derudover inspirerer din omverden til at se nye AI-perspektiver.




Dine ansvarsområder

I tæt samarbejde med forretningen og AI, Data & Cloud-teamet får du ansvaret for at:

Designe, udvikle og produktionssætte ML-løsninger på vores dataplatform (Snowflake, DBT, Azure m.m.).
Vedligeholde, optimere og videreudvikle data pipelines med fokus på robust drift og høj datakvalitet.
Eksperimentere med nye AI-teknologier (f.eks. GPT) og validere proof-of-concepts, herunder lovgivning og etik.
Sikre tydelig formidling af dataindsigter og AI-potentiale til forretningen.
Overvåge modellernes performance og løbende forbedre vores ML-infrastruktur gennem feedback og faglig sparring.




Teamet omkring dig

Du bliver en del af vores AI, Data & Cloud-team, der består af 8 data- og analyseeksperter. Heraf er tre (inkl. dig) Data Scientists. I teamet får du kolleger, som går op i nørdet vidensdeling og sætter en ære i at hjælpe hinanden til succes. Hele teamet vil selvfølgelig hjælpe dig med at komme godt i gang, og generelt er samarbejde og særligt faglig sparring en stor del af vores tilgang til arbejdet. Du vil have direkte reference til chefen for AI, Data & Cloud.




Er du den rette?

Vi søger en profil med stærk teknisk forståelse, en hands-on-mentalitet og evnen til at sikre høj kvalitet. Vi ønsker at anvende nye og relevante teknologier til arbejdet med Data Science, og den rette kandidat er derfor dig, der er naturligt nysgerrig og har lyst til at lære nyt. Du har gerne nogle års erhvervserfaring og er klar til at tage skridtet videre til Senior. Det vigtigste er, at du besidder et stærkt drive, er ansvarlig, selvkørende men samarbejdende og tilgår dit arbejde metodisk og struktureret med øje for detaljer.




Dine kvalifikationer:

Solid erfaring med programmering i Python og SQL.
Dokumenteret erfaring med ML-frameworks og værktøjer.
En stærk forståelse for statistiske metoder og modellering.
En akademisk baggrund fra f.eks. DTU Compute, Cand.scient.dat., Cand.it., MSc i Data Science eller en tilsvarende kvantitativ uddannelse.
Du taler og skriver dansk på et professionelt niveau, da en stor del af vores data og forretningsdialog foregår på dansk.




Hvis du har erfaring inden for ML, AI-teknologier og cloud-platforme (AWS, Azure, GCP) samt med at teste, vedligeholde og lancere AI/ML-produkter, er det et stort plus, men det er også noget, dine kommende kolleger gerne lærer fra sig. Måske har du stiftet bekendtskab med Docker, Git, Azure Cloud samt Snowflake og dbt, men det er ikke afgørende.




Vi tilbyder:

Muligheden for at sætte et unikt aftryk på Ledernes digitale transformation.
Kort vej fra idé til prototype eller MVP på vores Data Platform.
Et højt specialiseret data- og AI-team med masser af plads til sparring, eksperimenter og fordybelse.
En dynamisk organisation med 400 ansatte og mere end 135.000 medlemmer.
En uformel kultur, der vægter samarbejde, faglig udvikling og work-life-balance.
Syv ugers ferie, sundheds- og tandlægeforsikring, sportsaktiviteter, kantineordning fra Meyers (inkl. takeaway), massageordning m.m.
Fleksibel arbejdsplads med mulighed for at arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen.
Kontor på Vermlandsgade 65, 2300 København S – let at nå på cykel eller med offentlig transport.




Lyder stillingen som noget for dig?

Hvis du kan se dig selv i rollen, så send dit CV (uden billede) til os, og inkluder 3-5 linjer om din motivation for stillingen. Vi opfordrer dig til at ansøge hurtigst muligt og senest mandag d. 7. april, da vi afholder samtaler løbende. Skulle vi finde det rette match, inden ansøgningsfristen er udløbet, forbeholder vi os retten til at lukke stillingen.




Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du altid velkommen til at kontakte Chef for AI, Data & Cloud, Mathilde Loft, på e-mail: mlo@lho.dk.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Vil du arbejde med machine learning i et strategisk højt prioriteret miljø, hvor AI-udvikling er i fokus? Lederne søger en Senior Data Scientist, der vil tage del i at forme fremtidens AI-løsninger og samtidig fungere som teknisk sparringspartner for forretningen. Her får du frihed under ansvar, muligheden for at fordybe dig i de nyeste teknologier og et team af dygtige specialister, der deler din passion for data.


Hvem er vi?

Lederne er Danmarks største interesseorganisation og a-kasse for ledere. Vi er i gang med en digital transformation, hvor AI og data står centralt i at skabe de bedst mulige løsninger for vores mere end 135.000 medlemmer. Eksempelvis har vi allerede udviklet flere AI-baserede værktøjer, der bygger på kendte LLMs.


Din rolle som Senior Data Scientist

Som Senior Data Scientist hos Lederne får du en nøglerolle i at:

  • Designe, udvikle og drifte vores ML-platform og AI og automatiserings-løsninger.
  • Tage ejerskab over og definere retningen for, hvordan vi arbejder med AI efter best practice.
  • Opdage nye forretningsmuligheder i tæt samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af organisationen.


Du får altså en bred rolle, hvor du både koder, drifter og udvikler modeller og derudover inspirerer din omverden til at se nye AI-perspektiver.


Dine ansvarsområder

I tæt samarbejde med forretningen og AI, Data & Cloud-teamet får du ansvaret for at:

  • Designe, udvikle og produktionssætte ML-løsninger på vores dataplatform (Snowflake, DBT, Azure m.m.).
  • Vedligeholde, optimere og videreudvikle data pipelines med fokus på robust drift og høj datakvalitet.
  • Eksperimentere med nye AI-teknologier (f.eks. GPT) og validere proof-of-concepts, herunder lovgivning og etik.
  • Sikre tydelig formidling af dataindsigter og AI-potentiale til forretningen.
  • Overvåge modellernes performance og løbende forbedre vores ML-infrastruktur gennem feedback og faglig sparring.


Teamet omkring dig

Du bliver en del af vores AI, Data & Cloud-team, der består af 8 data- og analyseeksperter. Heraf er tre (inkl. dig) Data Scientists. I teamet får du kolleger, som går op i nørdet vidensdeling og sætter en ære i at hjælpe hinanden til succes. Hele teamet vil selvfølgelig hjælpe dig med at komme godt i gang, og generelt er samarbejde og særligt faglig sparring en stor del af vores tilgang til arbejdet. Du vil have direkte reference til chefen for AI, Data & Cloud.


Er du den rette?

Vi søger en profil med stærk teknisk forståelse, en hands-on-mentalitet og evnen til at sikre høj kvalitet. Vi ønsker at anvende nye og relevante teknologier til arbejdet med Data Science, og den rette kandidat er derfor dig, der er naturligt nysgerrig og har lyst til at lære nyt. Du har gerne nogle års erhvervserfaring og er klar til at tage skridtet videre til Senior. Det vigtigste er, at du besidder et stærkt drive, er ansvarlig, selvkørende men samarbejdende og tilgår dit arbejde metodisk og struktureret med øje for detaljer.


Dine kvalifikationer:

  • Solid erfaring med programmering i Python og SQL.
  • Dokumenteret erfaring med ML-frameworks og værktøjer.
  • En stærk forståelse for statistiske metoder og modellering.
  • En akademisk baggrund fra f.eks. DTU Compute, Cand.scient.dat., Cand.it., MSc i Data Science eller en tilsvarende kvantitativ uddannelse.
  • Du taler og skriver dansk på et professionelt niveau, da en stor del af vores data og forretningsdialog foregår på dansk.


Hvis du har erfaring inden for ML, AI-teknologier og cloud-platforme (AWS, Azure, GCP) samt med at teste, vedligeholde og lancere AI/ML-produkter, er det et stort plus, men det er også noget, dine kommende kolleger gerne lærer fra sig. Måske har du stiftet bekendtskab med Docker, Git, Azure Cloud samt Snowflake og dbt, men det er ikke afgørende.


Vi tilbyder:

  • Muligheden for at sætte et unikt aftryk på Ledernes digitale transformation.
  • Kort vej fra idé til prototype eller MVP på vores Data Platform.
  • Et højt specialiseret data- og AI-team med masser af plads til sparring, eksperimenter og fordybelse.
  • En dynamisk organisation med 400 ansatte og mere end 135.000 medlemmer.
  • En uformel kultur, der vægter samarbejde, faglig udvikling og work-life-balance.
  • Syv ugers ferie, sundheds- og tandlægeforsikring, sportsaktiviteter, kantineordning fra Meyers (inkl. takeaway), massageordning m.m.
  • Fleksibel arbejdsplads med mulighed for at arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen.
  • Kontor på Vermlandsgade 65, 2300 København S – let at nå på cykel eller med offentlig transport.


Lyder stillingen som noget for dig?

Hvis du kan se dig selv i rollen, så send dit CV (uden billede) til os, og inkluder 3-5 linjer om din motivation for stillingen. Vi opfordrer dig til at ansøge hurtigst muligt og senest mandag d. 7. april, da vi afholder samtaler løbende. Skulle vi finde det rette match, inden ansøgningsfristen er udløbet, forbeholder vi os retten til at lukke stillingen.


Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du altid velkommen til at kontakte Chef for AI, Data & Cloud, Mathilde Loft, på e-mail: mlo@lho.dk.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Title: Senior Software Developer – Python & Algorithms - Freelance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior Software Developer – Python & Algorithms - Freelance

Do you want to work in a young environment with quantum technology and complete systems that include lasers, advanced optics, motorized mechanics, and cryostats for quantum computing and communication applications. Then here is your chance!




On behalf of our client, we are looking for a Senior Software Developer for a +3 month fulltime assignment on-site Copenhagen




The job

You will lead the development of advanced control systems for both the R&D lab facilities and the quantum photonic systems they produce.




Your Role & Responsibilities

Lead the development of software for automation, real-time control, and data gathering in collaboration with the R&D and production teams.
Design and implement control systems for nano-positioning mechanical devices, lasers, Sensors, cryogenic systems, and photonic setups.
Develop robust software architectures and user interfaces for integrating photonic chips with full-system equipment.
Implement optimization algorithm for stabilization with motion control and signal processing using real-time detector feedback and Integrate AI and Digital Twin solutions.




Qualifications we are looking for

University degree in computer science or relevant field.
Programming languages: Python, (C# is a plus).
Automation & hardware control of motion mechanics, scientific equipment and instruments
Experience with real-time optimization algorithms and signal processing and detector feedback systems.
Software Architecture and experience with Digital Twin modeling for predictive system behavior and optimization.
Good English skills.




Interested?

Then you are welcome to apply for the job via the link “Easy Apply”.




Akkodis Denmark

At Akkodis Denmark, we specialize in finding the right candidates for the right assignment - especially when it comes to embedded IT. Our clients and consultants know us to be honest, professional, and transparent in the way we do business. We take pride in taking good care of our consultants.




Interested in more exiting embedded engineering assignments? Feel free to follow our linkedin group: "Akkodis Denmark – Jobs" here: https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/akkodis-denmark-jobs/?viewAsMember=true

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There is no quality healthcare without a quality dialogue. Today, that dialogue is broken; we need you to help us fix it.

Doctors and nurses across the world are facing unprecedented challenges. When we meet them, they're dealing with heavy workloads, extensive paperwork, and the pressure of performing well, which in healthcare, can have dire consequences. This system is gradually undermining the passion and autonomy of our dedicated healthcare professionals, who entered this field to provide care, not to clerk.

Corti has built the world's premier AI assistant for healthcare providers. It listens in during patient dialogue, takes notes, writes summaries, journals and does quality assurance. When information is missed, or risk is high, it offers nudges and prompts to help steer the dialogue back on the right path. Entire countries trust Corti to deliver better healthcare, and our AI has already helped millions of patients, but we are just getting started.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

📌 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti’s domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have


Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


You'll thrive in this role if you have the following


A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to have


Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.


Practicalities


The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

🤝 Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.﻿

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we’re passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we’re looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you’ll consider applying!

Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

🤝 Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.﻿

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we’re passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we’re looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you’ll consider applying!

Title: Python Applications Developer
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you an engineer with expertise in Python, cloud architecture, and CI/CD pipelines, eager to solve complex problems? Then you are the one we are looking for!

Your position

In your new position as application developer in the Product Line Team within our Renewables Department, you will be a valuable member of a dedicated team whose mission is to drive innovation and efficiency in offshore substation design. You will have the chance to work with ParaPy, an advanced software platform that empowers engineers to create detailed parametric 3D models and automate engineering processes efficiently. Above all, your work will make a real change for the global green energy transition.

At Semco Maritime, safety is a core value, and in this role, you will contribute to maintaining and promoting a strong safety culture while delivering innovative solutions.

Your place of work will be at our Global HQ in Esbjerg, in Nordhavn (CPH), Denmark, in Gdynia, Poland or Hamburg, Germany. The position is full-time, and you can expect to travel occasionally as required.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

As a application developer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining the ParaPy application, ensuring it aligns with business and engineering needs. You will work closely with engineers, architects, and managers to improve and refine our substation model.

Your Tasks Will Include But Are Not Limited To


Developing new features for the ParaPy application as required by the business.
Managing the building and release process of the ParaPy application.
Extending and maintaining our automated testing suite.
Translating engineering rules into code through scoping, clarification, and knowledge acquisition.
Building interfaces with other engineering applications.
Managing deployment and CI/CD pipelines to ensure seamless integration.


Your Profile & Qualifications

We are looking for an analytical and proactive engineer who is passionate about software development and automation in engineering processes. You should have a structured approach to problem-solving and a strong drive to innovate.

To succeed in this position, we imagine that you have:


A bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant engineering field.
At least 3 years of professional experience writing Python code and working with large code repositories.
Experience with cloud software (Azure), integrations between complex software solutions, and APIs.
Knowledge of UI web development frameworks (React) and UI/UX design principles.
Experience with software testing (PyTest), CI/CD pipelines, and Agile development tools (Jira, GitHub)
Knowledge of safety standards


Welcome to Semco Maritime

At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,500 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

Safety is at the core of everything we do, and we are committed to protecting our people, partners, and the planet as we work towards a sustainable energy future.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?

Change. With us.

We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page.

If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Head of Product Line Development, Stevan Akrap on +45 79 14 79 68.
Show more

Title: Product Developer - Soccer (Radar/DSP - Modelling - C++/Python)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Soccer and Signal Processing? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Soccer product team!

About The Job

We’re looking for a talented and motivated developer to join our team, working on innovative products within the soccer space. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of performance tracking and data-driven insights, with a particular focus on the development of tracking technology used by elite footballers and football teams worldwide.

Our technology integrates vision tracking with radar tracking to deliver precise ball data measurements throughout its entire flight. In this role, you'll be a key part of our Soccer Product Development, working across various domains such as signal processing, and modelling to build innovative solutions for performance analysis and optimization. From initial concept to final development, you’ll play a crucial part in enhancing our tracking solutions, applying your expertise to create real-world applications in soccer technology.

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, where the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, where after the radar data is fused with information from video feeds and other sensors. This valuable information is subsequently made accessible on the user’s mobile device for easy-to-understand feedback and analysis on performance or is used in TV broadcasting for enhancing the viewing experience or in gamification. 

Our world-leading tracking technology is utilized across many sports such as American football, golf and baseball, and you will specifically play a significant role in enhancing our soccer product solution.

Requirements

What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate is specialized in following areas

Requirements:


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Knowledge of data modeling


We are looking for a generalist with broad skills that include the requirements above. You should be passionate about applying your knowledge to solve real-world challenges and drive product development in an exciting and fast-paced industry.

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills
Machine learning
Interested in soccer


Responsibilities

Implement tracking algorithms in close collaboration with our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team and Modelling & Analysis team.

Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.

Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

The Office

We offer a great office environment and facilities in our brand-new purpose-built Trackman Innovation Center, located at DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We take great pride in the building we designed and built! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness center, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race. 

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion! 

Apply now
Show more
HTML:
Do you have an interest in Soccer and Signal Processing? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Soccer product team!

About The Job

We’re looking for a talented and motivated developer to join our team, working on innovative products within the soccer space. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of performance tracking and data-driven insights, with a particular focus on the development of tracking technology used by elite footballers and football teams worldwide.

Our technology integrates vision tracking with radar tracking to deliver precise ball data measurements throughout its entire flight. In this role, you'll be a key part of our Soccer Product Development, working across various domains such as signal processing, and modelling to build innovative solutions for performance analysis and optimization. From initial concept to final development, you’ll play a crucial part in enhancing our tracking solutions, applying your expertise to create real-world applications in soccer technology.

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, where the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, where after the radar data is fused with information from video feeds and other sensors. This valuable information is subsequently made accessible on the user’s mobile device for easy-to-understand feedback and analysis on performance or is used in TV broadcasting for enhancing the viewing experience or in gamification. 

Our world-leading tracking technology is utilized across many sports such as American football, golf and baseball, and you will specifically play a significant role in enhancing our soccer product solution.

Requirements

What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate is specialized in following areas

Requirements:

  • Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
  • Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
  • Knowledge of data modeling

We are looking for a generalist with broad skills that include the requirements above. You should be passionate about applying your knowledge to solve real-world challenges and drive product development in an exciting and fast-paced industry.

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

  • Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Optimization algorithms
  • Statistical signal processing
  • Software development experience
  • Strong communication skills
  • Machine learning
  • Interested in soccer

Responsibilities

Implement tracking algorithms in close collaboration with our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team and Modelling & Analysis team.

Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.

Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues.

We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Title: Software Engineer Data Scientist
Place: Rom By, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
CHE COSA CERCHIAMO

Rheinmetall Italia S.p.A sta cercando un/una Software Engineer Data Scientist da inserire all’interno dell'unità Sviluppo Software, per la propria sede di Roma.

Siamo leader mondiale nella Difesa e Sicurezza, operiamo in oltre 60 paesi come parte di uno dei principali gruppi industriali europei, Rheinmetall AG e siamo l’unica azienda nel settore della Difesa nel novero dei 40 titoli tedeschi a maggiore capitalizzazione e liquidità quotati sul segmento “Prime Standard” della Borsa di Francoforte (Dax 40).

Siamo un'azienda che sta affrontando un processo di evoluzione e trasformazione digitale in grado di creare opportunità di carriera in un ambiente di apprendimento e sviluppo continuo.

Etica, integrità, sostenibilità, inclusione, customer-centricity e innovazione sono i nostri valori da cui discende l'impegno per le nostre persone.

Sei una persona innovativa che ricerca il miglioramento continuo in tutto quello che fa?

Ti piace lavorare in team per migliorare i processi e le prestazioni della funzione in cui lavori?

Vuoi avere un ruolo attivo, che ti venga riconosciuto, nella crescita aziendale?

Vuoi lavorare con i migliori tecnici e/o ingegneri presenti nel mercato della difesa?

Vuoi acquisire nuove competenze e soft skills?

In qualità di Software Engineer Data Scientist sarai inserito/a in un team rivolto alla ricerca dell’eccellenza, e sarai coinvolto/a nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di soluzioni AI e di analisi avanzata dei dati, che assumono un ruolo strategico e mission-critical in una molteplicità di contesti. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con ingegneri e altri professionisti del settore, all’interno di team multidisciplinari, seguendo le pratiche Agile per la progettazione e realizzazione di modelli e pipeline di data processing.

Il Software Engineer nella funzione di Data Scientistsarà responsabile della raccolta, elaborazione e modellazione dei dati, nonché dell’implementazione di soluzioni di Machine Learning/Deep Learning di alta qualità, garantendone la validazione e la manutenzione. Collabora con il team, documenta il lavoro per assicurare la consegna di prodotti e analisi efficienti e funzionali, infine apprende costantemente nuove pratiche, framework e algoritmi di Intelligenza Artificiale.

La posizione prevede la progettazione e l’implementazione di modelli predittivi, di pipeline di elaborazione dati robuste, di alta qualità, che assicurino affidabilità, efficienza, sicurezza e manutenibilità. Verrà curato l’intero ciclo di vita dei progetti di AI: dall’analisi dei requisiti e della qualità dei dati, attraverso la definizione dei modelli e la loro validazione, fino all’integrazione su infrastrutture di calcolo on-premise o cloud.

Le tue principali attività saranno:



Analisi dei requisiti di sistema e studi di fattibilità;
Sviluppo e progettazione di applicativi di Data Science e non solo;
Realizzazione di pipeline dati (ETL/ELT), scripting e automazione di processi di data cleaning e feature engineering;
Redazione della documentazione tecnica in conformità agli standard aziendali e alle best practices;
Progettazione di suite di test per la validazione di modelli di Machine Learning/Deep Learning;
Ottimizzazione delle prestazioni, tuning degli algoritmi e delle pipeline di elaborazione dati, utilizzo di profiler e tool di analisi di performance;
Utilizzo di tools di gestione del ciclo di vita del software e di Continuos Integration/Delivery;
Garantire la qualità dei prodotti secondo gli standard aziendali.



CHE COSA DEVI PORTARE CON TE

Valutiamo con interesse:



Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ing. Informatica con focus su Intelligenza Artificiale;
Buona conoscenza della Iingua inglese parlata e scritta (livello B2);
Ottima conoscenza dei principali standard di analisi e progettazione del software O.O;
Ottima conoscenza di tutto il ciclo di vita del software e dei progetti di AI;
Ottima conoscenza di Python, Java e/o C++;
Ottima conoscenza dei framework/librerie TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LangChain;
Ottima conoscenza dei DB sia SQL che NoSQL;
Buona conoscenza dei principali strumenti di analisi dei dati: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib;
Buona conoscenza dei principi di TDD e Unit Testing per il test e la validazione del software prodotto;
Buone capacità di ottimizzazione del software attraverso l'uso di profiler e tools per l'analisi del codice statica e dinamica.



CHE COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Cosa offriamo:



Ambiente internazionale e caratterizzato da sfide e dinamicità
Opportunità di sviluppo professionale
Programmi di alta formazione
Un contesto lavorativo inclusivo, che abbraccia e valorizza l'unicità in tutte le sue forme
Retribuzione in linea con i maggiori players, proporzionata alle competenze e alla seniority possedute, che sarà compresa fra i 35k e i 40k
Programmi di Welfare innovativi e costruiti intorno alle persone
Assicurazione sanitaria
Ristorante Aziendale
Parcheggio per i dipendenti
Servizio Concierge
Modello di lavoro ibrido
Flessibilità oraria



Valutiamo con estremo interesse le candidature appartenenti alle categorie protette ai sensi degli artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei DL 215/03 e 216/03.

Le persone sono il nostro ASSET aziendale e rappresentano un patrimonio imprescindibile per l’innovazione del nostro business. I continui cambiamenti tecnologici e le trasformazioni del mercato richiedono flessibilità di pensiero, apprendimento rapido e mobilità. Invece della standardizzazione di massa, noi abbracciamo l'unicità di massa e la centricità umana.

_______________________________________________________________________

N.B.: Thank you for attaching your cv.

This announcement is addressed to both sexes, in accordance with Laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and nationalities, in accordance with DL 215/03 and 216/03.

We undertake to evaluate candidates belonging to the protected categories pursuant to art. 1 and 18, law 68/99.

PER INFORMAZIONI



migliarini@rheinmetall.it

Title: 3D Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

At Teton, we are redefining the role of healthcare workers through cutting-edge AI technology. Facing a global nursing shortage, our solutions offer vital support to overburdened health systems. We distinguish ourselves by focusing relentlessly on product excellence and user experience, rapidly deploying solutions that make a real difference.

At this stage of our company we require a physical presence in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark. We believe this enables the fastest and most efficient iteration cycles to build an impactful product that users love to use.

The Job

We’re looking for a dynamic and innovative 3D Vision Engineer who will transform our AI system outputs into essential tools for healthcare workers. You will play a critical role in developing new features, enhancing the core product, and lifting model detections and reasoning into 3D. Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency and effectiveness of healthcare delivery, providing much-needed support to healthcare professionals.

In this role, you will focus on the following areas of interest.


Computer vision 3D modelling
Training deep learning models for 3D understanding
Camera models, including 360 fisheye
Object detection and tracking in 3D


Qualifications


Experience with 3D modelling and camera geometry
Experience with Structure from Motion / SLAM
Solid deep learning understanding. Trained models for 3D geometry.
Python, PyTorch (experience with TensoRT is a plus)
Minimum 3 years experience
Show evidence of exceptional ability.


What We Offer


Participation in our warrant program (stock options).
Work with state-of-the-art technology in a pioneering field.
A vibrant, learning-focused work environment.
A role where you can make a significant impact on healthcare delivery.


Join Our Team

We're looking for individuals who share our vision and value ownership and entrepreneurship over a conventional job. At Teton, you'll have the chance to make a real impact with your work. If you're ready for more than just a job, come aboard and be part of our mission to transform healthcare.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST TIL AI-DREVET GRØN OMSTILLING
Description:
Vil du være med til at skabe fremtidens AI-løsninger og omsætte banebrydende innovation til værdi for dansk landbrug?




Hos SEGES Innovation søger vi en ambitiøs Data Scientist, som brænder for dataanalyse, AI-udvikling og for at gøre en reel forskel gennem Applied AI.




Et it-job med mening

SEGES Digital er SEGES Innovations digitale forretningsenhed. Vi er en førende organisation inden for udvikling af digitale løsninger til landbrugs- og fødevareområdet, og dedikerede til at forbedre landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren gennem innovative Digital og AI løsninger baseret på vores DataEstate.




Forretningsenheden Digital består af ca. 200 medarbejdere, der sammen med resten af SEGES Innovation er drevet af vores mission om at sikre fremtidens bæredygtige fødevarer. Det gør vi gennem forskning, innovation og digitale værktøjer, der optimerer og transformerer landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren igennem den grønne omstilling af erhvervet.




Om stillingen

I afdelingen Data & Analytics hos SEGES Innovation skaber vi værdi ved at udvikle intelligente løsninger til fremtidens landbrug. Vi overvåger dyrevelfærd i staldene ved hjælp af avanceret computer vision, holder øje med marker via satellitdata og optimerer landmandens beslutninger med præcise prognosemodeller. Vi eksperimenterer også med banebrydende generative AI-teknologier, der automatisk analyserer og håndterer store mængder tekst og dokumentation.




Som Data Scientist hos os får du mulighed for at arbejde med hele data science-livscyklussen – fra indledende analyse og feature-identifikation til avanceret modeludvikling, optimering, implementering og evaluering. Du vil få lejlighed til at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknikker inden for blandt andet computer vision, generative AI samt klassiske prædiktive modeller baseret på tabulære data. Hos os bliver du en del af et engageret team, der arbejder tæt sammen med faglige eksperter om at omsætte data til konkret værdi for landbruget.




Din rolle

Du arbejder med en varieret portefølje af projekter, hvor du anvender din ekspertise inden for dataanalyse, modellering og løsningsudvikling til at omsætte komplekse udfordringer til konkrete, værdiskabende løsninger. Du vil blive en nøgleperson i at sikre, at vores AI-drevne produkter konstant er relevante, effektive og værdiskabende for dansk landbrug.




Din rolle indebærer

Udvikling af AI-løsninger i samarbejde med faglige eksperter fra Innovationsafdelingen.
Selvstændigt ansvar for AI-projekter med fokus på dataanalyse, modeludvikling og dokumentation af resultater.
Arbejde med klassiske AI-principper, såsom supervised og unsupervised machine learning.
Håndtering af forskellige typer data, fx tidsserier, billeder, geospatiale data og tekst.
Løbende dialog, sparring og præsentation af resultater til interne interessenter.
Aktivt bidrag til kompetenceopbygning inden for AI og data science i både projekt- og produktkontekster.




Hvad vi drømmer om...

Vi ser gerne, at du har erfaring inden for data science, men lysten til at lære er vigtigere end nuværende kompetenceniveau.




Faglige kompetencer

Kendskab til datatyper som f.eks. tidsserier, geospatiale data, video/billede eller tekst.
Erfaring med Azure og/eller Databricks.
Solide kompetencer inden for Python.
Kendskab til CI/CD-principper.




Personlige kompetencer

En pragmatisk tilgang til opgaverne.
Evnen til hurtigt at tilegne dig ny viden og omsætte den til praksis.
Stærke samarbejdsevner og lyst til at være en aktiv del af et team.
En naturlig nysgerrighed og interesse for at følge med i AI-udviklingen.

Frem for alt søger vi en person med stort gåpåmod, ægte interesse for området og en stærk vilje til konstant at lære og udvikle sig.




Hvad vi tilbyder

I SEGES Innovation tilbyder vi dig en karriere med mening. Vores innovation og viden gør en stor forskel i at skabe en bæredygtig fødevareproduktion. Vores specialister arbejder med alt fra klima og miljø, planter, husdyr og digitale løsninger til vækst og vidensformidling.




Sammen bidrager vi til de løsninger, der gør landbruget og fødevareproduktionen endnu mere bæredygtig. Vi er 500 kolleger, der brænder for det, vi arbejder med. Vi omsætter for omkring 630 millioner kr. årligt.




I det digitale område af SEGES Innovation arbejder vi agilt med digitale produkt teams, der primært arbejder med SCRUM og hvis vi i al beskedenhed selv skal sige det er hamrende gode, men også kan blive bedre. Du får derfor mulighed for at sætte dit aftryk på organisationens fremtidige udvikling.




Vi tilbyder derudover en attraktiv lønpakke, fleksible arbejdsbetingelser og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling.




Ansøg nu

Lyder det interessant, og kan du se dig selv i stillingen, så upload ansøgning og dit CV via "Søg jobbet".




Vil du vide mere?

Du kan læse mere om SEGES Digital her: https://segesinnovation.dk/landing-pages/et-it-job-med-mening/

Du kan se en tv-serie om, hvordan det er at arbejde i SEGES Digital, her: https://segesinnovation.dk/landing-pages/kodernes-kamp/




Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Director, Morten Ryberg på 2812 7341 eller på mory@seges.dk







Ved rekruttering hos SEGES Innovation prioriterer vi primært din faglige ekspertise og personlighed. Vi ser mangfoldighed som en styrke, derfor opfordres alle med de rette kompetencer til at søge - uanset etnisk tilhørsforhold, religion, kønsidentitet og alder.




SEGES Innovation er en uafhængig forsknings- og innovationsvirksomhed, der arbejder for en bæredygtig og konkurrencedygtig landbrugs- og fødevareproduktion. Vi kobler faglige indsigter med digitale teknologier, så ny viden kommer ud at virke i stalden, på marken og i hele værdikæden fra jord til bord.




Vores mange forskellige eksperter udgør et unikt fagmiljø i international topklasse med ca. 500 dedikerede kolleger, der arbejder ud fra værdierne Mod, Hjerte og Dybde og i tæt samspil med Danmarks mere end 30.000 landbrug, universiteter og uddannelsesinstitutioner, landbrugsrådgivere, fødevareproducenter, energiselskaber og myndigheder.

Show more
HTML:
Vil du være med til at skabe fremtidens AI-løsninger og omsætte banebrydende innovation til værdi for dansk landbrug?


Hos SEGES Innovation søger vi en ambitiøs Data Scientist, som brænder for dataanalyse, AI-udvikling og for at gøre en reel forskel gennem Applied AI.


Et it-job med mening

SEGES Digital er SEGES Innovations digitale forretningsenhed. Vi er en førende organisation inden for udvikling af digitale løsninger til landbrugs- og fødevareområdet, og dedikerede til at forbedre landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren gennem innovative Digital og AI løsninger baseret på vores DataEstate.


Forretningsenheden Digital består af ca. 200 medarbejdere, der sammen med resten af SEGES Innovation er drevet af vores mission om at sikre fremtidens bæredygtige fødevarer. Det gør vi gennem forskning, innovation og digitale værktøjer, der optimerer og transformerer landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren igennem den grønne omstilling af erhvervet.


Om stillingen

I afdelingen Data & Analytics hos SEGES Innovation skaber vi værdi ved at udvikle intelligente løsninger til fremtidens landbrug. Vi overvåger dyrevelfærd i staldene ved hjælp af avanceret computer vision, holder øje med marker via satellitdata og optimerer landmandens beslutninger med præcise prognosemodeller. Vi eksperimenterer også med banebrydende generative AI-teknologier, der automatisk analyserer og håndterer store mængder tekst og dokumentation.


Som Data Scientist hos os får du mulighed for at arbejde med hele data science-livscyklussen – fra indledende analyse og feature-identifikation til avanceret modeludvikling, optimering, implementering og evaluering. Du vil få lejlighed til at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknikker inden for blandt andet computer vision, generative AI samt klassiske prædiktive modeller baseret på tabulære data. Hos os bliver du en del af et engageret team, der arbejder tæt sammen med faglige eksperter om at omsætte data til konkret værdi for landbruget.


Din rolle

Du arbejder med en varieret portefølje af projekter, hvor du anvender din ekspertise inden for dataanalyse, modellering og løsningsudvikling til at omsætte komplekse udfordringer til konkrete, værdiskabende løsninger. Du vil blive en nøgleperson i at sikre, at vores AI-drevne produkter konstant er relevante, effektive og værdiskabende for dansk landbrug.


Din rolle indebærer

  • Udvikling af AI-løsninger i samarbejde med faglige eksperter fra Innovationsafdelingen.
  • Selvstændigt ansvar for AI-projekter med fokus på dataanalyse, modeludvikling og dokumentation af resultater.
  • Arbejde med klassiske AI-principper, såsom supervised og unsupervised machine learning.
  • Håndtering af forskellige typer data, fx tidsserier, billeder, geospatiale data og tekst.
  • Løbende dialog, sparring og præsentation af resultater til interne interessenter.
  • Aktivt bidrag til kompetenceopbygning inden for AI og data science i både projekt- og produktkontekster.


Hvad vi drømmer om...

Vi ser gerne, at du har erfaring inden for data science, men lysten til at lære er vigtigere end nuværende kompetenceniveau.


Faglige kompetencer

  • Kendskab til datatyper som f.eks. tidsserier, geospatiale data, video/billede eller tekst.
  • Erfaring med Azure og/eller Databricks.
  • Solide kompetencer inden for Python.
  • Kendskab til CI/CD-principper.


Personlige kompetencer

  • En pragmatisk tilgang til opgaverne.
  • Evnen til hurtigt at tilegne dig ny viden og omsætte den til praksis.
  • Stærke samarbejdsevner og lyst til at være en aktiv del af et team.
  • En naturlig nysgerrighed og interesse for at følge med i AI-udviklingen.

Frem for alt søger vi en person med stort gåpåmod, ægte interesse for området og en stærk vilje til konstant at lære og udvikle sig.

Title: Product Developer - American Football (Radar/DSP - Modelling - C++/Python)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in American Football and Signal Processing? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcasts all around the world?  Then come and join our American Football product team!

About The Job

We’re looking for a talented and motivated developer to join our team, working on innovative products within the American football space. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of performance tracking and data-driven insights, with a particular focus on the development of tracking technology used by elite football players and football teams.

Our technology integrates vision tracking with radar tracking to deliver precise ball data measurements throughout its entire flight. In this role, you'll be a key part of our American Football Product Development, working across various domains such as signal processing, and modelling to build innovative solutions for performance analysis and optimization. From initial concept to final development, you’ll play a crucial part in enhancing our tracking solutions, applying your expertise to create real-world applications in American football technology.

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, where the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, where after the radar data is fused with information from video feeds and other sensors. This valuable information is subsequently made accessible on the user’s mobile device for easy-to-understand feedback and analysis on performance or is used in TV broadcasting for enhancing the viewing experience or in gamification. 

Our world-leading tracking technology is utilized across many sports such as soccer, golf and baseball, and you will specifically play a significant role in enhancing our American football product solution.

Requirements

What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate is specialized in the following areas

Requirements:


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematical modelling, or equivalent
Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Knowledge of data modeling


We are looking for a generalist with broad skills that include the requirements above. You should be passionate about applying your knowledge to solve real-world challenges and drive product development in an exciting and fast-paced industry.

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills
Machine learning
Interested in American football


Responsibilities

Implement tracking algorithms in close collaboration with our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team and Modelling & Analysis team.

Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.

Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

The Office

We offer a great office environment and facilities in our brand-new purpose-built Trackman Innovation Center, located at DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We take great pride in the building we designed and built! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness center, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race. 

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion! 

Apply now
Show more

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.

Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?


Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we are committed to creating and contributing to an inclusive workplace. And this strategy starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.


Who are you ideally?


You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.


Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.

Primary Responsibilities


Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap


Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.


Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!


Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - an industry with a significant global influence. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.

We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.

The question is: Are you in?

Title: Projektingeniør - Nordjylland
Description:
Har du en passion for programmering af SCADA- og/eller PLC-applikationer? Og kan du se dig selv i et team, hvor samarbejde, sparring og godt humør vægtes højt?

Så er du måske vores nye kollega! Vi oplever høj kundetilfredshed og stor efterspørgsel og søger derfor lige nu en engageret projektingeniør til vores kontorer i Nordjylland.

Din nye hverdag som projektingeniør hos Init

Som Projektingeniør Hos Init Vil Du Udvikle Skræddersyede Løsninger Til Vores Kunder På Både Store Og Små Projekter. Du Vil Deltage i Alle Faser Af Projektet – Fra Det Indledende Kundemøde Til Implementering, Test Og Aflevering. Dine Arbejdsopgaver Vil Bl.a. Omfatte


Design, programmering og implementering af PLC- og/eller SCADA-styrede automationsløsninger.
Fejlfinding, vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende programmer og udstyr.
Tværfagligt samarbejde både internt og eksternt for at sikre succesfuld integration af dine automationsløsninger.
Udvikling og dokumentation af automationsstrategier og -procedurer.


Om dig 

Vi Forestiller Os, At Du Er Uddannet Ingeniør, Maskinmester, Automationsteknolog, Elektriker Eller Lignende Og Har Erfaring Med SCADA Og/eller PLC-programmering. Derudover Søger Vi Dig, Der


Er god til at kommunikere med både kolleger, kunder og leverandører.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt og struktureret med dine opgaver.
Er en holdspiller og en vellidt kollega, som forstår vigtigheden af at sparre og dele ud af din viden.


Hvorfor blive en del af Init?

Som Vores Nye Kollega Bliver Du En Del Af En Læringsorienteret Arbejdsplads Med En Nærværende Ledelse, Der Går Op i Din Trivsel Og Udvikling. Vi Tilbyder Bl.a. En Konkurrencedygtig Lønpakke, Attraktive Vilkår Og En Arbejdsplads, Hvor Du Vil Opleve


En afvekslende hverdag, hvor du bliver udfordret og ser konkrete resultater af dit arbejde.
Høj faglighed og spændende projekter inden for moderne teknologier.
Stor frihed til selv at tilrettelægge dit arbejde.
Et team af dygtige kolleger, som du kan sparre med i hverdagen


Lyder det som noget for dig? Så glæder vi os til at høre fra dig!

Du ansøger stillingen ved at udfylde formularen og uploade dit CV samt evt. en ansøgning.

Hvis du har spørgsmål eller blot er nysgerrig på at høre mere om rollen og Init, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte os.

Om Init

Du bliver en del af Init – en virksomhed i vækst, som har en ambition om at samle de bedste virksomheder og mennesker inden for Industriel IT og Automation. I dag er vi i Danmark ca. 450 medarbejdere fordelt på mere end 20 lokationer. Vi lægger vægt på at give dig et sjovt, sikkert og inkluderende arbejdsmiljø. Vores motto – ”We are Init together” – gælder både, når vi samarbejder med kolleger om at gøre Init til en attraktiv arbejdsplads, og når vi samarbejder med kunder for at forme fremtiden inden for Industriel IT og Automation.

Title: Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer, Tryg Privat
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi udvider vores forretningsorienterede Data Science & AI Modelling-team i Trygs privatforretning. Derfor søger vi nye kollegaer med baggrund som Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler. Vi leder efter personer med stærke kompetencer inden for modellering, machine learning, data og softwareudvikling, som også har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring udvikling, implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller for at optimere salg og styrke fastholdelsen af vores kunder.

Om rollen | Understøt kunderejsen i Tryg

I din nye rolle, vil du sammen med teamet udvikle full-stack løsninger, der typisk baserer sig på moderne anvendt statistik og machine learning-algoritmer. Du vil få berøring med flere dele af værdikæden, herunder at identificere behov, bygge business cases, etablere datagrundlag, modellere, implementere, monitorere og lave effektmålinger.

Mere konkret vil du og teamet arbejde med:


Churn-modellering og fastholdelse
Lead-generering og produktanbefaling
Optimering af salg, f.eks. "Next Best Offer" samt tilhørende databehandling og datamodellering samt opbygning af software-infrastruktur hertil.


Uanset din baggrund, får du mulighed for at præge dine arbejdsopgaver i en retning, hvor de skaber størst forretningsværdi og dine kompetencer udnyttes på bedste vis. Vi mener nemlig, at de bedste løsninger opstår i tæt samarbejde med forretningen. Derfor er en vigtig del af jobbet også at kommunikere direkte med stakeholders i forretningen for at forstå deres processer og udfordringer, så du kan hjælpe med at yde effektiv beslutningsstøtte og understøtte den gode kundeoplevelse.

Vores tech-stack inkluderer en række forskellige teknologier, som du vil arbejde med, heriblandt:


Virtuelle maskiner i Azure
Kafka, Mongo- og SQL-databaser
Docker og Kubernetes
En Python-baseret kodebase i Gitlab


Output fra vores løsninger distribueres typisk til produktionssystemer via web services. Vores analytiske platform er under løbende udvikling, hvilket betyder, at du skal være parat til at håndtere udfordringer inden for data, værktøjer og infrastruktur. Vi er dog godt på vej i den rigtige retning og ser frem til at fortsætte denne udvikling med din hjælp.

Om dig | Kompetent, erfaren og forretningsorienteret

Din baggrund kan både være som Data Scientist med erfaring i at bygge machine learning-applikationer i en forretningskontekst, eller som Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler med erfaring inden for data science området. Det vigtigste er, at du trives med forretningsdialog og besidder gode kommunikationskompetencer, så du kan formidle dine idéer og sikre en god forståelse mellem analyse og forretning. Derudover, har du en interesse i Trygs forretning, systemer og processer, da det kræver et godt domænekendskab for at kunne levere værdiskabende modeller og løsninger.

Vi forventer, at du har:


Stærke data- og modelleringskompetencer kombineret med et godt forretningsmindset
Praktisk erfaring med implementering af data pipelines og machine learning-modeller i produktion, og især i Engineer-rollen erfaring med at opbygge infrastruktur hertil.
Bred viden indenfor statistiske metoder, herunder machine learning-modeller, neurale netværk, boosting metoder, A/B-testing og overlevelsesanalyse især i Data Scientist-rollen.
En relevant uddannelsesbaggrund i machine learning, statistik, matematik, økonomi, datalogi, IT eller lignende.


Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har:


Erfaring med følgende sprog, pakker og værktøjer, som vi anvender: Python, SQL, NO-SQL, Gitlab, Kafka, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure, Linux, Cloud Computing, Webservices, Jupyterlab, PyTorch og Sci-kit Learn.
Interesse i GDPR, AI act, dataetik m.v. således at du kan sikre en stærk compliance i dit arbejde.


Da vi er ved at udvide teamet, har vi mulighed for at være fleksible med sammensætningen af kompetencer og profiler i teamet, så uddyb gerne hvilken del af profilen du brænder for og kan bidrage med.

Om os | Et stærkt analysemiljø

Du bliver en del af vores Data Science & AI Modelling-team, som er placeret tæt på forretningen i Technical Excellence i Trygs privatforretning. Foruden Data Science & AI Modelling består Technical Excellence af vores Portfolio Management- og Pricing teams, hvor vi har mange års erfaring med at arbejde med data og modeller i en forretningskontekst. Derudover bliver du en del af et stærkt fagligt netværk på tværs af Trygs forretningsområder.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Technical Excellence, Bjørn Sandqvist på bjoern.sandqvist@tryg.dk eller +45 21753879, eller leder af Data Science & AI Modelling afdelingen, Tobias Sommer Thune på tobias.thune@tryg.dk. Vi opfordrer dig til at søge hurtigst muligt, da vi afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når de rette kandidater er fundet.

Ansøgningsfrist: 18. april 2025.

Diversitet & inklusion skaber et stærkere Tryg

Vi mener, at mangfoldighed i tankegang er afgørende for vores fremtidige succes, og vi ønsker at afspejle det samfund, vi er en del af. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet på at sikre en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads, hvor du føler dig respekteret, kan være dig selv og har lige muligheder for at udvikle dig og gøre karriere.

Vi opfordrer derfor alle, uanset køn, alder, oprindelse eller baggrund, til at søge stillingen.

Læs mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde i Tryg

Sammen om din karriereudvikling

Hos Tryg har vi høj medarbejdertilfredshed og et stærkt tværfagligt miljø med gode karrieremuligheder. Udvikling og læring er en konstant proces hos os, og vi ønsker, at du vokser og udvikler dig sammen med os.

Uanset om du vil udvide dine faglige kompetencer, tage næste skridt i karrieren eller udforske nye områder, støtter vi dig på din udviklingsrejse.

Udforsk dine muligheder her

Er vores kendetegn også dine?

Vis tillid

Hos Tryg bygger vi på hinandens tillid, når vi bevæger os ud på ukendt grund som morgendagens tryghedsskaber. Vi tror på, at tillid og frihed under ansvar motiverer din nysgerrighed og dit mod til at gå nye veje. Du får ledere og kolleger, der lægger vægt på både trivsel og resultater.

Hos Tryg oplever du en kultur, der bygger på tillid, ansvar og udvikling hele vejen rundt..

Tag ansvar

Når du starter i Tryg, vil du hurtigt opdage, at ansvar er noget, der fylder. Jo mere ansvar, du vil have, jo mere får du, når du viser, at du kan leve op til det.

Her får du mandat til at udforske nye muligheder, koncepter og løsninger, der skaber tryghed for kunder, kollegaer og samfund i dag og i morgen.

Skab udvikling

I Tryg går du forrest og skaber udviklingen sammen med dine kolleger. Det kræver både mod, vilje og evnen til at gå nye veje. Her tør vi tage chancer, og det giver dig frihed til at forfølge dine idéer og skabe noget nyt.

Det giver store muligheder for dig, som kan, vil og tør sætte tryk på din egen og på Trygs udvikling.

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Description:
Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!




The Mission Awaits:

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.




Your role as an Engineering Manager:

Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.




Ideal Qualifications:

Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!




What’s in it for you:

A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops




Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

Show more
